case.state: Well, well, who do we have here?
Ah, here we are. I was hoping I could find something interesting here...
Oh, ~human~! It's nice to... see you again?
Hello again, ~player~. Do you have room for me here?
Ah, of course you are here, ~player~. What shall it be for you today? Stunning victory or most humiliating defeat?
There you are, ~player~. I believe you and I have an ongoing score to settle.
Y'shtola Rhul, Scion of the Seventh Dawn. A pleasure to make your acquaintance.
Well, this one has an air about her...
Do mine eyes deceive me? It figures such creatures would find this place.
So, they would even venture out beyond our star.
Hmm, I've sensed a presence like this one before...
The aether... something is amiss...
There is a pressure here, a sort I know all too well.
Is this it then? Bit of an intimate affair with just the three of us.
A smaller, quieter game can be fun too.
Hm, 'twould be easy enough to beat just two people.
Well, I'm not one to back down from a little extra challenge. By all means, let's fill more seats.
There is a sort of safety in numbers when it comes to activities like this.
Well, if we're going this far we might as well fill the whole table. Wouldn't you agree, ~player~?
Appears we're all set to start now.
If we're all assembled now, mayhap we should get things underway.
Should be entertaining with this many in attendance.
Are we really playing here? Not exactly what I envisioned for my vacation.
I came here to relax, have a little vacation as it were; however... this is not the local I had in mind.
I guess I'm not opposed to playing here on principle, though I'd expected to spend my vacation in a different local.
A bit patronizing, this one.
I did not realize I needed your express permission to play...
Oh no, you can't fool me, little one. The aether about you is not that of a common insect.
If you could not tell, I am taking a bit of a vacation here. I suppose a quick game wouldn't go amiss.
The beaches of Eorzea are nice, but I find it hard to relax back home. The Inventory is by far the most laid back place I know of.
I'd hoped I could have a relaxing vacation for once. When I try to take my leisure back home, something always comes up. The only thing that comes up here is, well, one of these games.
A fine Valentioneâ€™s Day to you, ~player~. So, how do I look? Rather dapper, if I do say so myself.
So, is there some manner of celebration of romance in your world too, ~player~? Seems too perfect to be a coincidence.
Well met, ~player~. Spending Valentione's Day among these scoundrels? Though, I suppose that makes me a scoundrel too. 'Tis something I can live with.
Ah, you're probably wondering about the ears. I assure you, they are quite real.
Oh, is there something different about me today? I daresay you might be on to something.
Does this attire make my ears look big?
So we're starting? Excellent. Waiting around was growing quite dull. I find myself in most unusual spirits to~background.time~.
Now this should be an interesting experience...
There is nothing amiss, I trust? I promise that I'm feeling quite better than I ever have.
Merry Starlight Celebration, or at least a auspicious winter solstice.
Well, a merry Starlight Celebration to you. Perhaps a bit more merry after a few rounds here.
I suppose I should wish you all a merry Starlight Celebration before the proceedings really start getting underway.
Oh... well... as far as clearing the air goes... this is as extreme as it gets...
Perhaps this will serve as an amusing distraction from my research. Let us proceed.
I've been charging porxies in the relict for days now. I need to be doing literally anything but that right now.
I've no strong apprehensions about playing this game, especially if it means I may observe the goings on of The Inventory. In fact, I rather relish the challenge.
No, no, no, pray give me a moment...
Ah, hold, can we wait one moment?
Bobobo are you--- wait, hold on!
I'll have ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
Let us exchange ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ this round.
Yes, ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~. That will suffice.
I suppose ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~?
I shall stay this hand.
No need for any cards this round.
I require no more cards. This hand will see me through.
No, this whole hand shall need to go.
This time I shall exchange all my cards.
Well, this bodes ill.'Twould be best to start from scratch.
Aye, if memory serves this will be best.
I apologize for my behavior during this game. I pray you will not think less of me for it.
If I acted less than admirably today, I do hope you won't hold it against me.
Looks like I've caught a big one.
Ah, yes. The pretty girl on vacation gets the good cards. 'Tis only natural.
If leisure has dulled my edge, it has at least not hurt my luck.
'Tis always more fun and relaxing to win, wouldn't you say, ~player~?
Sometimes it pays to simply relax.
I've half a mind to trade these cards for a drink served in a coconut.
The weather is so nice, I thought I might offer someone else the chance to doff their clothes and enjoy the sunshine.
See, now that's more like it. I can relax after I've won.
What is it that they say? "Take a load off?" Nay, not this time.
And here I thought all my luck floated off into the sea...
If this is not a nudist beach, it very soon shall be.
I suppose any angler with the patience gets a lucky catch here and there.
I tend to put up more of a fight than other tourists.
Aye, I won't be caught lounging about this time.
Chocolate is a bit too sweet for my tastes, but victory? Aye, that shall be just right.
'Twould be apropos if the best hand were all hearts? Mayhap too apropos!
Seems I might have an admirer...
You know, this sort of luck wouldn't hurt when it came to men... ha, as if!
'Tis more excitement that I usually see this time of year. More skin too, which I don't particularly mind.
House Valentione promises luck in love, so this must be something of my own doing.
All these cards and not a single flower? I can appreciate the gesture, but I would like to be courted properly.
Well, well. Seems the one I've been waiting for has finally shown up.
They say love hurts, but do not eschew my thrashing you for affection.
A little good luck does give one a warm, fuzzy feeling...
Come now, doffing one's clothes is a time honored tradition for Valentione's Day. I would encourage the rest of you to embrace it.
'Twas only a matter of time until I got lucky. Ah, that is... you know what I mean!
If experience is any lesson, my trouncing you will not dampen your affections.
Ah, now that's more like it. Still, the excitement is heart pounding.
'Tis superstition that a rabbit's foot brings good fortune. I had the presence of mind to bring two with me, as it were.
Now this is a nice find, if I do say so myself.
I had to win more than my fair share of Triple Triad games to obtain this attire, so don't think I'm rusty when it comes to playing cards.
So, ~player~, do you prefer cats or rabbits?
Looks good, but 'tis unwise to count one's chickens before they hatch.
I'm enjoying this frivolity more than I care to admit. I've quite outdone myself this time.
Well, would you look at that? My luck's got me over the moon.
Ah, yes. Cracking, this one.
Don't think I'd be so careless as to let my losses multiply.
I shouldn't bother myself overmuch with my previous losses. There's still potential for a comeback.
Don't underestimate me just because I look like this. Oh, I refer to my state of dress not my Viera appearance. Though, I suppose it still applies.
This day grows stranger by the moment. 'Tis amusing to say the least.
Sure enough, I'll be coming back from this.
Come now. The game will not lose itself. Let's hop to it.
Seems playing cards may be beneath me now. I rather did not expect that.
No need to be afraid. I am quite in control of my faculties, moreso than e'er before, I daresay.
I am full of strange appetites to~background.time~. Oh, don't look so concerned. I promise any harm that comes to you will be purely accidental.
Hm, seems like I might be in for a treat...
Oh, I ought to be taking notes. Hm, pity I feel no inclination to do so.
'Twas certainly worth breaking free for this. I wonder what I ought to do next...
This visage is not that intimidating, is it?
I've been on my best behavior all year. Endeavoring to safeguard this star and her people, you see. Very worthy behavior.
How delightful to receive what I wanted without needing to even ask.
The cold weather of the season has never bothered me much. I know well enough to pack enough layers to keep warm.
I hope you don't feel too left out in the cold when you lose...
How about we give someone else a chance to unwrap something.
If I keep getting cards like this, I might be compelled to give a gift in return.
'Twould my preference to take home a victory wrapped up in a bow, as it were.
Maybe this time I won't be left out in the cold.
Now I'd thank you to be good and lose for me.
Anyone else feeling a tad... under-decorated?
Well then, let's see what you got for me.
I've been good all year, so it shouldn't be a problem to be naught for just a little while...
Sorry, but you don't always get what you want.
Ha, I have a present for you.
I need not fear the outcome of this round.
You shall be found wanting, as expected.
I look forward to this round's conclusion.
That's the way. Less risk and more reward.
Don't mind me, just surveying the aether.
Not much of a challenge.
A spot of good luck never went awry.
I still have a few tricks up my sleeves, which you may notice I am still wearing.
Playing strip poker is irresponsible, aye; however, at least I'm not the one who decided to go up against me.
I won't be caught off guard this time.
I can ill afford to relax, even with a hand like this.
Very well, I can make my stand with this.
I tend put up more of a fight then others in my profession.
Let us not tarry...
Aye, this will not take long.
I can see the way has opened.
This is it ~opponent~. No matter the outcome, no hard feelings, okay?
Whichever way this ends, ~opponent~, I do hope we will still be amicable afterward.
I have such trouble remembering when All Saints Wake is each year. Feels like it changes every time. Never been one to turn down any reason to don a costume.
Convenient that the season for ostentatious costumes is upon us. I'd have trouble blending in like this otherwise...
I've made do with less.
Perhaps watching this round play out will be more exciting for me.
Ah well, there is naught else to do but watch things unfold.
'Tis no more than anyone would do.
Aye, this shall be a trifle.
I do believe I shall hold out.
Seeing as we must play whatever hand we have, there is little point in deception.
I fear the worst may come to pass.
I do not like this uneasiness...
I'm sure this is the best I could muster in these present circumstances.
I'll not go gently into the darkness.
I am not one to run from my troubles.
Not entirely sure what to think here.
Mayhap it was a mistake not taking more of a risk.
It appears we will have our victor anon.
This is it: the decisive hand.
What's a vacation without a bit of unwise expenditure?
I beg your pardon, but I'm on vacation here. I do believe I'm owed a bit better fortune.
Mayhap I've become too relaxed here...
Not exactly the catch of the day, as they say.
I put bait on the line, but I've got nary a bite...
I'd intended to take my leisure, but I must needs try a bit harder than this.
Fie, a spot of bad luck. Like dark clouds encroaching upon a sunny day.
So much for relaxing...
Hardly my idea of leisure to get bested to handily...
This is shaping up to be a more exciting vacation than I'd bargained for.
Aye, just as I planned it. Sun, sand, and utter defeat...
One trip to the beach and I've lost all sense of strategy, it would seem.
Well, at least there aren't any jellyfish...
It may actually be more relaxing to simply lose if it prevents me from having to fret over hands like these.
Ah, well, sometimes we experience heartbreak. That's life.
I guess my heart just wasn't in it this time...
What's this? Some poor attempt at flirting?
Fie. I'd say these cards are not well suited for me...
Trying my hardest to make a pair on Valentione's Day. Fitting, I should say.
Well, this is less than ideal. Mayhap I am distracted. Not with thoughts of romance, I promise that!
Ah, a handful of cards I do not desire? Must be Valentione's Day...
I've a funny feeling in my chest, and 'tis not love...
I'm not exactly in love with my hand over here...
The poor luck on Valentione's Day is something I'm used to, but the excitement...
In some messed up, cosmic way, should I be grateful someone is trying to get me naked on Valentione's Day?
Not so much ardor as arduous...
Ah, yes. The arrival of unwanted cards on Valentione's Day. A tradition I am familiar with...
Mayhap this is retribution for those I've spurned, but I've no regrets. Not even for a little sun.
Even if my luck is poor, you'll nary see me crack.
I do hope I didn't waste too much of my good fortune at the Golden Saucer...
Forget eggs. Hand me a brush that I might fix this hand...
The Archons of old would hardly be impressed...
Ah, a pity. I suppose not every hand will have me jumping up and down.
Mayhap I should have taken more time to acclimate to this form.
By the Twelve. I gambled to obtain these clothes, but now I am gambling myself out of them.
Seems my plans have lain an egg...
Seems cruel that I should lose my tail and be saddled with such poor luck...
Should not have put my eggs all in that one basket.
I hoped my spring would be sweet, not fleeting.
Not likely I'll find a way out of this one.
I do think the cracks are starting to show...
Dear me, if I don't focus up the fun will be over far too soon.
Well, I might be more comfortable with less on anyway.
It is a bit hard to think straight when the smell of living aether is so much more potent than usual...
Pity one can have so much power and still be stifled by the luck of the draw.
Defeat's sting is not as keen as it once was. Better than being bored.
Gods, I'm so distracted to~background.time~. Can't focus on what I'm doing with this hunger gnawing at me.
Well, if this doesn't go well, I could simply go back to testing my strength...
Hm, tricked by my own elevated hubris, no doubt. Shame that.
They cannot all be just what I was asking for, now can they?
Mayhap I should petition Saint of Nymeia for a bit of extra luck...
Am I expected to act grateful for this?
The winter's cold seems to be bearing down upon me...
Oh dear, it may be my turn to give the rest of you a gift.
A spot of poor luck here or there won't dampen my spirits, not at this time of year.
I suppose I can still afford to make the rest of you merry.
Were these meant for someone else? I certainly did not ask for this.
Now seems like a poor season to be miserly with the good cards...
Alas, seems I will have to access my more generous spirit this round.
'Tis a bit late to simply wait around for a miracle...
Well, 'tis not like I've been perfect this year, but who hasn't had a dalliance or two?
Another hand like this and a certain someone may end up boiled in their pudding with a stake of holly through their heart...
Gods, if I can't string some better hands together I am going to end up unseasonably underdressed.
Perhaps I have erred somewhere.
I have been neglectful in my observations, it would seem.
I suppose one must play the hand they are dealt, quite literally in this case.
I assumed the risk, but I've not reaped the reward this time.
Sown the seeds of my own undoing, as though I were a novice at this.
Well, that backfired. Naught that I can do about it now.
Fie! This one shall be mine to lose.
Perchance fortune is spoiling to see me disrobe as well.
Yes, well, I'd still rather not lose if I can help it.
Come now, this hardly seems sporting.
Should I simply brace for the worst?
Twelve forfend...
This need not be a losing hand. Failure is out of the question.
Ignore my ramblings...
No succor to be found here.
Have I failed?
I've naught of an advantage here...

Well, I'm originally from Sharlayan. Long has it held the acquisition of knowledge chief among all things, even to the point that it will not intervene in world affairs. That is, personally, a stance I could not assume...
Hm? It seems to be a picture... of a woman? I don't see what's so-ah... oh...
I'm unfamiliar with that term: Kwami. Is he some manner of familiar or perhaps some variety of Fae creature?
The make-up was a nice touch, but your aether gave away the ruse. For what it's worth you're more spirited than the zombies I've seen. Well, almost all the zombies I've seen.
Oh my. Fascinating. If I could make a study of the underlying mechanics... ah, but perhaps now is not the time.
Did you expect that I would take it easy on you if you were a novice? That is... well it's... hm, not altogether unlikely everything considered.
Just the two ears, like anyone else here. Though, there's no telling how many ears you're hiding under that box.

Ah, how could I forget? I saw some cute shoes in a shop window in Limsa. Little strapping things with dyed leather flowers. I thought to buy them, but they were expensive and I am something of a pauper. A shame, really.
Cute? Well, when I was young I made a water- ah, on second thought...

Funny thing, ~player~, but our Warrior of Light also has the same proclivity for ~player.ifMale(men|women)~ you do. Of course, ~player.ifMale(he has his husband|she has her wife)~ to help deal with this baser urges. Though, I guess I don't know if you have someone like that yourself.
It is hard to turn down a hot bath. 'Tis the sort of thing I very sorely need but hardly ever have a chance to indulge in.
Like I could trust everyone here to behave themselves in a bath.
I've never had the displeasure myself, Megumin, but 'tis not uncommon for an inexperienced adventurer to get lapped up by a Nix.
The biggest? Hm, that's hard to say exactly. 'Tis rare that I go into combat alone, especially against larger foes.
Bobobo, do not think we are finished discussing this... or that I approve of all these extra pairs of pants!
If the bugs here are cause enough to give you fright, you'd not like the beaches back on Eorzea. We've got crabs the size of horses.
Aye, I'd designs to enjoy the water myself. Best to do it with some company; 'tis unwise to swim in the ocean by oneself.
Well, Leonie, should I win this game still dressed like this, 'twould almost be criminal not to take a dip.
Actually, getting into the water and hiding sounds like a bright idea currently.

Well, 'tis not "dye" strictly speaking, but some adventurers do cast a glamour that turns their clothes invisible. Men in full plate armor walk about appearing in nothing but their pants. It's... something.
In my experience magic has many practical applications outside of martial use. Though, I may be biased since I did enjoy all those years of reading and study.

The Scions aren't really looking for outside help at the moment... but mayhap 'twould be convenient to send somebody to the Aurum Vale to gather some Morbol Fruit. Its curative properties merit more study.

The Scions aren't really looking for outside help at the moment... but there have been troubling rumors of a primal in the Twelveswood. It would be nice if someone could check the state of things, oh, but leave any swords you find alone.

The Scions aren't really looking for outside help at the moment... but my own tasks leave me a bit busy to get a book I need from the Great Gubal Library: a treatise on the Void. It's likely safe to open.
Gods, the last thing I need is to run into anyone I know here, let alone invite them along.
Either way, they need a proper dressing down for it. Depending how they react to that, you can certainly tell if it's one, the other, or both.
Well... when he's serious all the time and only ever teases you, one does get a strong impression there's something there.
I've nary heard such self pitying drivel...
Though I can sympathize, I'm not feeling much like pitying you at the moment.
What brought about this question, Kaz? Don't tell me someone deceived you? A pity, but it could not have been very difficult.

For places too far to walking, I use teleportation magicks. Though, I've known adventurers to travel as you do. If one looks skyward, sometimes you can spot them flying about on all manner of... well, "vehicles" might be too generous...
Am I really the only Miqo'te here? I suppose that's not too unusual, but perhaps we are uncommon in your worlds. Perhaps our culture would be a subject of interest?
I'll not be bothered by an audience. Whether it 'tis two or ten strangers who see me nude, I know not what difference it makes.
Hardly any spot in the Inventory is truly private, least of all this place. That the prying eyes are in full view of our own is something of a blessing, I would say.
It is equal parts amusing and frightful to know that I shall not recall a single face from the crowd, but they will no doubt remember me should this game go poorly.
By the Twelve! One moment, please. This accursed shirt seems to want to expose me before my time...
No fluffy cottontail, as you can see.
'Tis been quite some time since I simply took my leisure. Back home I have scarcely the time to drink a cup of tea before some disaster comes knocking upon our door.
I suppose I could have simply worn my usual clothes, but 'tis easier to get out of a working mindset with a change of attire.
The new headquarters of the Scions is much farther north than our old one. I thank the gods for that, as the summers down in Thanalan were nigh unbearable.
I do hope my manner of dress is not too garish. It has been some time since I've had occasion to wear a bathing suit.
Were we to charter a boat to carry us across the sea beyond the Inventory's beach, I wonder where we would end up? Mayhap we would simply tumble o'er the edge and vanish. Quite the curiosity.
I did warn my companions I'd be out of contact for a brief period to take a vacation of sorts. I doubt they could surmise a place like this as my destination.
I suppose Costa Del Sol is pleasant enough for a trip to the beach, but the area is infested with massive jellyfish. Terribly unpleasant.
I know tourist traps oft try to separate visitors from their money, but seems this one is merely after our clothes.
Were this place more accessible, I imagine it would be swamped with eager tourists. Considering what we're up to, that's likely for the best.
Finally, a spot of sea air and sunshine free from pirates squabbling with sahagin or sahagin squabbling with pirates. You'd be hard pressed to find that in Eorzea.
Surely I can't be the only one hiding from the chaos of their home for a brief respite?
Perhaps I'll actually take time to attend this year's Moonfire Faire. 'Tis so rare for me to be in the mood for festivities.
Don't mind me, just wondering if I should go for a swim.

There is a place in Eorzea called Coerthas. 'Twas once a temperate place with a fair clime, but it has unfortunately turned into a frigid tundra. Merchants there specializing in summer attire have all gone quite broke, as you can imagine.
'Twould be fun to show Thancred my bathing suit. Should he compliment me, I shall chastise him. If he does not, then I shall also chastise him.
A little rest and respite does a body good. I'll admit I've taxed myself as of late, but with so much at stake 'tis difficult not to.
Next time I chance to enjoy the beach, I shall have to remember to wear something more conservative. Perhaps a diving suit or a house...
Some of the people around here have this notion that Miqo'te are afraid of the water. Allow me to state this quite plainly: we are not.
Clearly I'm not in the habit of going to the beach in a bathing suit. Were I to show up at the Bloodshore in such a state of undress, I'd be quickly mistaken for a prostitute.
Well, let it not be said that my bathing suit wasn't seen. Lyse would have been cross with me had I stayed covered up.
I've seen adventurers take to the battlefield in not much more than a bathing suit. I'm a small measure closer to understanding them... but I've a long way to go.
Better than being naked in the woods. At least I am conscious this time.
I hope I don't get a strange tan on my back. I'm sure the others would notice and have questions...
~Player~, when I am done with my vacation, remind me to return here and scold you for gawping at me so.
I suppose the only way this could get worse is if some jellyfish suddenly turned up...
Better to be undressed neath the heat of the big sun rather than the stare of the little sun...
I do wonder what chanced to bring you here, ~player~. Is this your vacation spot as well?

I know not what is more embarrassing, that I absently undid all these buttons or that I prattled on about... about... ah, very well. The prattling is more embarrassing. I-I see that clearly now. Ahem...
Valentione's Day has not been of particular interest to me. Far too much to do to worry about ardor and affection.
The knights of House Valentione were much insistent that I purchase these clothes. They said my own true love would find me if I wore them. Though I doubt that claim, I enjoy a good costume change.

Ishgard is cold, especially in the winter, but House Valentione emerges to bring word of romance and affection to all of Eorzea this time each year. 'Tis admirable, even if they are a bit bombastic...
I'm not much one for frilly dresses or aprons, but I think this outfit rather suits me. Could do with a more exciting pair of shoes, but alas...
I find it hard to believe anyone here is truly celebrating Valentione's Day or what have you in earnest. All eyes are on those private rooms strewn about, of that there is little doubt.
Were the other Scions to see me dressed like this, I imagine they'd be quite surprised. I am not the most... let us say "passionate" person, I know. 'Tis untrue that I am entirely cold-hearted.
The streets of Ul'dah are covered in hearts. Gridania's trees are festooned with pink and red banners. Even in Limsa Lominsa, ships strew roses upon the waters.
Do you think, perhaps, all this stripping is a proper courtship ritual in some adjacent world? Seems rather backwards to me.
Oh dear, I do hope none of your are here pursuing love. All this lusting clouds the mind.
Eorzea is beset by doe-eyed suitors this time of year. While I admire their passion, they do buy up all the good pastries. 'Tis absolutely devastating for tea time.
I'm not sure what festivals are held in your worlds to celebrate love, but it is comforting to know that even in those far flung places the people still desire such affection.
Valentione's Day festivities are far too saccharine for me, but someday, I hope, I will have time for ardor in my life as well.
Don't mind me, just wondering if I should bring back some sweets for my companions.
House Valentione is not a particularly influential house in Ishgard. Their knights have a woeful history in battle, but they're all said to be exceptional pastry chefs.
My fellow scion, Thancred, oh how he dreads Valentione's Day. He must make himself scarce, lest all his girlfriends seek him out and discover one another.
Marriages in Eorzea are typically political, but among adventurers, whose lives can be brief and tragic, love is ever the motivation.
I thought I'd dressed rather conservatively, but now look at me...
Oh, please. My choice of undergarments today was not meant to seduce any of you... o-or anyone specific for that matter!
I know garters may seem like a risque choice, but they keep my stockings up while I'm wearing trousers. I realize that's not an issue at this exact moment, but...
I should probably pay my sister, Y'mhitra, a visit after this. We can tease each other about being single over some tea. I'm thinking... rooibos. Her treat, of course.

Plenty of adventurers out there dress provocatively at all times, whether they are defending encampments from sand worms or dismantling a dwarven super weapon. I suppose one never knows when they shall meet that special person...
Of course, Valentione's Day is not merely about romantic feelings, but also platonic ones. If you've companions at your side, now is as good a time as any to remind them of your appreciation.
Valentione's Day encourages us to confess our feelings of affection. Such an act takes courage, less than it takes to expose oneself here.
~Player~, if you want to curry favor with me again after all of this is done, perchance you could provide me with some of your world's pastries. 'Tis an apropos time, is it not?
So, I take we are all lonely hearts then? Or, mayhap not lonely, but singular? I know it does not have the same ring, but you understand my meaning, yes?
I do wonder sometimes. Is it better to put romantic feelings aside while the world is in peril so they are not a distraction, or would it be better to embrace them lest the worst comes to pass?
So, what of you, ~player~? Is there someone out there who has caught your eye?
Viera, those people with the ears of a rabbit, are not particularly common in Eorzea. On top of that, the men are far more scarce than the women.
This is the waitress uniform at the Golden Saucer. They sell them to curious patrons, for a hefty sum of course.
Hatching-tide is a curious little holiday we have in Eorzea. A young maiden had a dream so now we all paint eggs. Even knowing the history, 'tis still so strange.
I'm still getting used to the ears. I can't tell if my hearing is any better, but they certainly are heavier.
Rumor has it there was an adventurer who ate thousands upon thousands of eggs nonstop to prove his strength. They called him "The Eggwalker."
I suppose I could have just worn bunny ears, but this just seemed like more fun.
Hatching-tide is, in a small way, a celebration of the Archons of old. As a modern Archon, I wonder if there will be a holiday in our honor in the far-flung future.
As far as I know, bunny costumes were not inspired by Viera, an actual race of rabbit-eared people. It just seems to have manifested organically on its own.
In some cultures, cats are good luck; however, in others rabbits are lucky. Today we put these superstitions to the proof.
I do hope this change in appearance isn't too alarming. I daresay 'tis a measure more extreme than a simple costume change.
There are always spriggans wandering about with eggs during Hatching-tide. I do not mind them so much, but they do tend to get underfoot...
Spring in Eorzea is ever so pleasant. The forests of Gridania in full bloom, the warm sea breezes in Limsa Lominsa, and Ul'dah... remains dusty and hot.
I considered wearing a traditional egg helmet, but alas these ears make wearing most hats nearly impossible.
Hatching-tide is, above all, a festival of hope. Hope that not only will we be delivered from calamity, but in calamity's wake we will rise again.
Chickens and rabbits are traditional symbols of spring and fertility in Eorzea, though evidently not just in Eorzea.
Thank the Twelve that Hatching-tide is a springtime festival. Imagine wearing these tights in the dead of winter.
... I miss my tail.
I may be unaccustomed to this body, but 'tis still a bit embarrassing being seen naked in it as strange as that is to say.
Mayhap I should have worn one of those full-body rabbit costumes adventurers sometimes wear...
On the bright side, even disrobed I am still properly attired.
I'm not really concerned about those I know seeing me in this form. Even if they got a good glimpse of me they would not know who they were looking at.
Well, I suppose this is more exciting than Hatching-tide usually is.
If I lose while in this form... well, that should be an interesting experience...
So, any egg centric holidays where you hail from, ~player~? If there was one, I don't think I'd be surprised.
Hatching-tide has its fair share of eccentrics. Men and woman dressed in full hare and chicken costumes, darting about to prepare for the festivities.
I never did get to collect eggs when I was younger. My master was more interested in frogs than chickens...
The potion that changed me would have allowed for a myriad of adjustments to my body, but I elected not to tamper overmuch with a perfectly fine thing.
Eorzea has her own celebration of costumes and the creepy: The All Saints Wake. I generally find it more charming than scary, but I've fought actual ghosts and monsters...
I've never seen an actual ghost with a pumpkin for a head. I am unsure where that imagery comes from. One would suppose it's just because there's lot of pumpkins this time of year.
A surfeit of aether is good for many things, but of course extremely dangerous. Oh, don't look so frightened. I am mostly sure of what I am doing.
I do so love the autumn. The changing colors, the cool weather, nobody questioning your monstrous appearance in public...
Seems like the aether has accentuated more of my beastly qualities. There must be a fascinating reason behind that, so it's a something of a shame I've neglected my plans to document any of this.
The use of glamours to masks one's appearance aetherically is an old practice in Eorzea. Would that I could comfort you that my change is merely an illusion, but alas...
I feel so spirited to~background.time~. So unusually vigorous and full of inexplicable hungers. It's quite fascinating.
Normally I can see aether just fine, but now I can smell it too. It's so unlike any natural smell, but it does strangely whet the appetite...

It's not an uncommon practice to unbalance one's aether to briefly increase one's physical strength or magical potency. I'm an expert in this field in both study and practice, so please stop looking so concerned.
Is this how the Warrior of Light feels all the time? Certainly explains all the snark.
I've seen the affects that a surfeit of light aether can have on a person firsthand. You have my full assurance that I know what I'm doing and I'm not being entirely irresponsible.
Come now, if this experiment had been a bad idea we'd not be standing here having a civil conversation about it.
Hm, would I attempt to take this form again? Maybe, should its usefulness outweigh any consequences. If you've never had aether sickness, just imagine being terribly hungover and seasick...

The people out celebrating the All Saints Wake were quite taken with my appearance. I told them it wasn't a costume, but they merely thought I was playing a part. I am unused to such attention, but 'twas better than screaming and running.
The scariest thing I can think of to dress up as? Mm, probably my mentor Master Matoya. 'Twould be quite horrifying to consider what she'd do to me after finding out I stole her clothes.
The chains are no cause for concern, I assure you. They were merely a safety measure that obviously was neither necessary nor effective.
Red clothes are a tradition in the Starlight Celebration. We pay homage to those knights who risked their station to help those most in need during the coldest time of the year.
My mentor was never too keen on celebrating the season when I was a child. I've no nostalgic attachment to the holiday, but 'tis hard not to get swept up in everyone else's excitement.
What sort of traditions do you have to ring in the winter season? Would it happen to involve decorating a coniferous tree?
I do like sweaters, but I do not often have occasion to wear them. They protect well enough against a cold breeze, but not so much against sharp blades, bullets, and explosives.
I know the white hair and the red costume make me seem like a certain benevolent saint, but I'd do well to remind you have no great white beard. Trust me; I am of no relation to the man.
I should probably get the other Scions something to mark the season. For everything they've done this year, I suppose some sort of show of gratitude is in order.
Mind if I ask you what to get the man who has everything? Something sentimental, yes? Hm, that places me at a distinct disadvantage.
If I'm going to end up without my clothes, I shall certainly need a nice cup of tea to warm myself after all this is through.
What would I like as a gift? Shoes.
No, cold weather is not so bad. 'Tis a good excuse to have an extra cup of tea every so often.
Maybe it seems strange to celebrate the coming of winter, as winter can be harsh and difficult; however, the occassion serves to remind us to be kind to one another even in those trying times.
Mistletoe, a poisonous and parasitic plant, is gathered up by the bushel to help decorate for the Starlight Celebration. Passing strange, is it not?
Hm, perhaps I should give more thought to what sort of gifts my companions would like to receive.
This is the time of year we petition Nymeia and her saint for aid and succor. I shall presently be praying for a spot of luck.
So, was there anything you were hoping to receive this winter? Other than seeing the people here with their clothes off, of course.
Maybe I should wear more red. I do think the color rather suites me.
Oh, what a predicament. This and the fact that I'll be hard pressed to give anyone a gift when I myself am destitute. I'll need to petition Tataru for help...
Maybe I should have worn one of those full-sized snowman costumes. Mayhap 'twould have postponed this fate...
This can't be any more embarrassing than getting up on stage to sing those silly old carols...
Well, I could use some new winter clothes. In general, not just in this particular fix I find myself in.
When all is said and done, I'd rather be seen like this than wearing one of those ridiculous reindeer outfits...
Though the Starlight Celebration is mostly enjoyed by children, there is obviously a more mature component to the season.
Fie, even the trees are more dress this time of year...
Should I even bother asking you what you want, ~player~, or would I just be opening myself up to have a pass made at me?
This is most certainly how I normally make myself merry...
Take care during this season of light lest you forget that darkness to has its place. Spare a though to those who cannot yet grasp joy.
Quite indecorous to treat me as some sort of gift to be unwrapped, but I can let it slide this once in the spirit of the season.
I don't suppose we've bitten off more than we can chew, ~nerves~?

'Tis nice to see another sorceress here. I've no companions of our ilk, aside from perhaps my mentor, Master Matoya. She is... well, we get along well enough. Mayhap you've struggled with your own mentor's approval.
We are all well versed in the rules of this game, yes? And what is at stake should one lose with no clothes left?
I figured there was a possibility for other mages to be here. Do you have any particular field of study?
Having your arm by your side while playing this game? I suppose one must be ready for anything, but it does make one wonder if there is something we should be worried about.
I do wonder how Lyse would feel about playing a game like this. She did hide behind that mask for all those years...

Interesting to see an Elezen here. I've a handful of Elezen colleagues to be sure. Speaking of which, 'twas difficult to sneak out to this place without Urianger noticing. My absences from the Rising Stones have not gone unnoticed by him.

I see we've an Elezen here with us. Honestly, 'tis a bit unexpected given those I know. I can scarcely imagine Alphinaud or Alisaie playing this sort of game. Alphinaud would lose his mettle far too quickly, and Alisaie her temper.
You are an Elezen, are you not, ~elf~? The founder of the Scions was also an Elezen, a man by the name of Louisoix Leveilleur. We owe our lives and more to his bravery.

Hm, a bit on the short side but clearly not a Lalafell. We count more than a few Lalafell among our ranks, including dear Tataru Taru. If naught else, I think she'd be interested in seeing all the different clothes.

Short, but not Lalafell short. Come to think of it, I wonder how Krile would fare in this game? Her ability to read others proves useful for card games, but should we have more than cards on our minds, she may not be so keen on doing so.
My, what piercing red eyes, ~redeyed~. I would suppose 'tis unlikely you carry royal blood of the ancient Allagans, correct?
Red eyes, just like G'raha. The fellow has a nigh unquenchable thirst for adventure, and maybe even something like this wouldn't be outside his interest.
Is there a story behind that tattoo? Does it mark some occasion or denote your status? Back in Sharlayan those of us who are Archons all bear the same tattoo upon our necks to denote our status.
So, ~shutin~, I take it you don't get out too much? I don't mean to judge, gods know I'm in no place. I spent most of my formative years in a cave going over dusty old tomes with Master Matoya.

My work has placed me in Limsa Lominsa, one of Eorzea's prominent city states, for quite some time. The city was founded by pirates and is still a thalassocracy til this day. I guarantee you would be right at home there, ~pirate~.
Even in a place like this, I suppose there could be bad actors. Dimensional boundaries are hardly an obstacle for the Ascians, so 'tis not impossible they could have made their way here.
Such a strong presence of aether about ~god~. It all seems stable enough, so I suppose there is no danger. Still, this one could very well be a primal...
Is it the fashion where you are from to be hairless down there, ~shaved~? 'Tis most peculiar.
They say the women of Thavnair are all shaved down there too. Of course, I've no idea if that is even remotely the case.
This fashion of being shaved down there is awfully daring. Is this something men like? Or women? I admit to being a bit... ignorant.
I realize "Scion of the Seventh Dawn" is a meaningless title outside of Eorzea. Our purpose is to safeguard the realm free from the bonds of political affiliation. 'Tis all there is to it.

I pray you do not mind too much if I make a bit of a study of this. As denizens of far flung worlds, your experiences and thoughts are of unprecedented scholarly interest. I will, out of respect, ne'er mention your nudity, of course.

Perhaps I should explain a little. I lost the use of my eyes in an... incident. I can still see using a bit of clever sorcery, and while that has its limitations my sight is practically as clear as it was previously.

'Tis true my eyes are no longer sensitive to light, but I'm not entirely without sight. My method of seeing now is magical in nature, allowing me to see just as well as I could before. 'Tis not without drawback, but it has its advantages too.

'Twould not be entirely accurate to say I am blind. Physically, I am unable to see; however, through more arcane methods I am able to compensate for that. I can see, 'tis just the methodology that differs. It has its own pros and cons.
Aether is, in simplest terms, elemental energy. It is employed in magecraft to perform magicks, but 'tis also flowing and affecting all around it passively. When out of balance, disaster oft follows.

The Echo is... well, difficult to explain to a lay person. 'Tis considered a blessing, making one more sensitive to the thoughts and feelings of those around them. 'Tis not solely clairvoyance, but 'tis often the impression it gives.

Krile has been a longtime ally of the Scions. She's a scholar among scholars, one of the most brilliant arcanists of our time. Even in areas I had struggled, she'd been able to furnish us with a solution.

Lyse is a fellow Scion and a dear friend. She's a talented pugilist, and 'tis comforting to finally see her come into her place in the world. Though the storm of conflict took much from her, she stood firm at the helm.

Tataru is the secretary for the Scions. She keeps our books, procures our supplies, and generally frets over our health. When we're light on funds, she tries her hand at many a trade to try and earn some extra coin for us.

Thancred is a fellow Scion. He's quite rough around the edges, but his talent for espionage is invaluable to our operations. He performs his duties quite diligently, especially if there are ladies about.

I hail from a world we call The Source. The First is an offshoot, an entire world separate yet inextricably linked to our own. Travel between the two is nigh impossible, but I was still conveyed there in a rather fantastic accident.

Alphinaud and Alisae are actually the twin grandchildren of an old ally. Despite their youth, they are immensely talented in both magic and politics. Of course, they scarce hold a candle to me at their age...

Urianger is a fellow Scion, one of my esteemed colleagues. He's wise beyond his years and incredibly well read, but he has a penchant for being theatrical that some find a bit hard to follow, even in idle conversation.
Both times I was plucked from the lifestream, I was told later I was completely naked when I emerged. I was mortified, to say the least.

I'll not deny part of my motivation for playing stems from when I was retrieved from the lifestream, unconscious and undressed. It is oddly reassuring to be seen undressed at a time of my own choosing.

Hm? Would I ever get married? Ha, quite the question, ~player~. I never considered it too much, but I suppose I haven't completely written it off. There is scarce time for romance when the world is in constant peril, unfortunately.
Thancred once told me of a place like this in Ul'dah. The only difference is I believe the women there are paid to play poorly...
After my unplanned trip to the First, I've taken an interest in inter-dimensional travel. The Inventory, as bizarre as it is, has piqued my interest for that very reason.
Card games are popular in Eorzea as well. We have a game called Triple Triad. I'll have you know that I am quite good at it.
This place is not unlike the Manderville Gold Saucer. The games are different, but the clientele is certainly just as diverse.
I have seen Hyurs, Elezen, and some other Miqo'te here, but I've not seen a single Lalafell. There's not some height requirement to get in, is there?
It seems that aether is not a concept recognized in all the worlds represented here. I've studied aether all my life, so the very thought has been a bit much to wrap myself around.
For most of my life I studied conjuration and white magic. It wasn't until fairly recently that I began studying thaumaturgy and black magic.
I'm a fairly accomplished healer where I am from, but I am just as effective in dispatching my foes. One must be able to defend oneself in my occupation.
I do not like to think about it, but many of the other Scions have chanced to see me naked. Twice in a couple of cases...
When I was in The Studium, there was rumor of a game not unlike this being played in secret. Had half of Sharlayan in an uproar until it turned out to be students betting small change on dice...
Were I possessed of the Echo, I gather I might make trivial work of this game.
'Tis a little unorthodox, but I'm pleased to learn a bit more of other world here. I'm nothing if not a lifelong learner.
It may be improper to be enjoying a game like this, but at least I have the excuse that I was brought up in a cave.
Things have been rather busy as of late. 'Tis good to be able to make time for a distraction. There's hardly time enough to read a book or look for shoes.
'Tis fortunate there is aether present in this place and its denizens, else I might be in a bit of a bind...

I spent what was for me three years in a world apart, but when I returned nary a month had passed since I left. I should be older and wiser for it, but here I am engaging in this irresponsible behavior. Mayhap 'tis for the best, in the end.
I do hope nobody is expecting me to disrobe all at once. I do still have a self-preservation instinct, after all. I'll make no complaint if anyone else does the same.
A small reminder lest any among you have any unpleasantness planned: turning you all into frogs would not be difficult.

Even if the world is in peril, one must take time to sleep, eat, and drink water. I'd perhaps not classify satisfying sexual curiosity as a "need," but it does run the risk of being a distraction if left unattended.
I've oft been accused of overworking myself, and others do have to force me to take breaks. Mayhap my extreme exertions justify this sort of extreme method of taking my leisure.
Well, I certainly won't be telling the other Scions of this. Especially not if I happen to lose.
There are street performances in Ul'dah with dancing girls wearing scarcely anything. I have presently gained a new respect for these women.
I often encountered some dancers in Vesper Bay. They certainly never wore much whilst working. Their manager did try to recruit me once. Just once.
A fellow scion has told me they often run into adventurers who wear very little, even on the battlefield. What drives them to do so ~player.ifMale(he|she)~ could not say.
There are those who find enjoyment in combat even though it 'tis inherently risky. One could suppose this game is nary any different, in a sense.
I keep thinking how strange this all is and somehow that brings me great comfort.
The very secrets of inter-dimensional travel laid bare, and yet 'tis used to give travelers a chance to play this game. The very notion is laughable.

state.text: ~Player~... you are staring...

case.state: I've no qualm with games that require luck. No contest is ever truly fair, and as a veteran of many battles I know how fickle fortune is.
What was that club in Eulmore called? The Beehive? Aye, there is a venue suited for this game.
~Player~, you seem fairly acquainted with this place. Mayhap when all of this is over, we could compare notes.
For all the battles I've seen, I've nary a scar to show for it. Bless those chirurgeons and conjurers who ever had the sorry task of mending my foolishly earned wounds.
Is it strange that standing here like this has earned me fewer proposals of marriage than shattering a crag against a contingent of Oronir tribesmen?
For all my education, I've something of a bad habit of throwing myself into peril without thinking. Seems coming here and playing this game is just the latest example.
Since you're all unfamiliar with Miqo'te, you're probably curious about my name. The "Y" is actually an indicator that I was born to the Jaguar, or "Y", clan. Shtola of the Jaguar clan, as it were.

Those unfamiliar with tribal Miqo'te society are always shocked to learn I have twelve half-sisters, with all of us sharing a father. He was our tribe's Nuhn. Only a Nuhn has reproductive rights until another male bests him in combat.
Oh, if you've never seen a Miqo'te before, you're likely very curious about my tail. You mustn't touch or grab it just as, I hope, you would not touch any other part of my person without permission.

Other races sometimes talk about how expressive Miqo'te ears are, but the rest of you have expressive ears as well. When embarrassed, the tips of your ears turn red. I've not met a miqo'te girl who doesn't think that's cute.

If I'm the first Miqo'te you've seen, just know I'm not exactly like all miqo'te. I am what they call a Seeker of the Sun. There are also Keepers of the moon. Often they have paler skin, rounded pupils, pronounced canines, and lots of cultural differences as well.

My, how you all stare. Is one Miqo'te really so strange? In Eorzea, cities are packed with not just men like you and I, but beastmen as well. Goblins, Qiqirin, Kobolds, Amalj'aa, Sahagin, Ixal, and the list goes on.
Hm, it's me this time? Apologies. I zoned out for a moment.
Already in a foul mood, Revy? Mayhap you need a vacation more than I do. A little relaxation might even you out a little.
Ah yes, the ash-smelling Hyur. I see the weather has done nothing to soften your disposition. Perhaps you could use a vacation yourself.
No, I am merely here for recreational purposes. My studies are the farthest thing from my mind at the moment, or at least I am endeavoring to get them there.
Believe it or not, I am capable of taking my leisure. No research, no inquiries, just a little rest and relaxation.

The aether displacement required to affect entire weather systems would be staggering, Meia. Enacting such a change would also have cascading affects across the entirety of the star. The affects might be permanent as well, such was the case in Coerthas.

Ay, terraforming and weather manipulation are possible, but highly impractical. The requisite energy would be colossal and no doubt its release would have a ripple effect across the whole star. The results could be irreversible, much like the case in Coerthas.
La-hee?
I imagine it feels much better than a plan falling apart...
Gods, I can't believe I let you get into my head like that...
Well, man plans and the gods laugh, as they say...
I think I'll manage, Bobobo. I should admonish you for being corny, but the levity does make this easier.
Yes, yes, you can simmer down, Bobobo. Gods, I'm just about to expose myself and here I am grinning like a fool...

Of course it's the ears. If they have some insult to level 'tis always the ears, never the tail. Of course, if they want to pick me up it's always "show us that tail, lassie." "Lessee you shake that tail!"

It's always "that bitch with cat ears" or "this cat-eared whore." The insults always mention the ears, but never the tail. They will ask "let's see that tail, sweet thing," but never call me a "cat tailed harlot" or what have you.
Not even going to try and hide your excitement, Bobobo?
It is as clear as ever that subtlety is not your strong point, Bobobo.
Clearly, you've no reservations about celebrating my loss, Bobobo.
Oh? And what exactly does this "master plan" of yours entail?
Pray tell, Bobobo, what is this "master plan" you have brewing?
I didn't finger you for a schemer, Bobobo. What's this about a "master plan?"
Yes, I could see how you would benefit from such a move, Bobobo; however, I fail to see how it avails me.
Ha, not exactly the most moving sales pitch. What makes you think I'd be so brazen?
Unfortunately for you, 'tis not the plan to take off more than I have to if it can be helped.
I'm... not sure I take your meaning of that, Bobobo. Not that I oft grasp what you're really saying...
I've been called all manner of things, but I believe "Puss in Boots" is a new one. Not sure I understand what you're trying to imply...
"Puss in Boots?" I've been called more vulgar things... at least, I think? Can't say I actually know what that means.
If you continue jeering at me, you will have to actualize me walking out the door, Bobobo.
Continue to conduct yourself in this manner, and you'll have to actualize continuing without me.
You've actualized nothing, but if you keep it up you might get even less than that.
You say that... but I think I would rather "wig out."
No, I think I could go for a "wig out" just about now.
If it's all the same to you, I believe I shall "wig out."
'Twould be no trouble at all to answer that, Fina. I hail from the city-states of Eorzea. Miqo'te like me are a sight more common there than most places others here traveled from, it seems.
Unacquainted with aether, are we? Aether takes many forms: It flows freely through the air and it courses through our bodies. In its most potent form, it does coalesce into a crystal of pure energy.

Curious about aether? 'Tis not just a crystal, but manifests as energy or force of will in a number of elemental forms. When concentrated and purified, it does convert into a solid crystal. As a crystal, 'tis at it's most potent.
Truth be told about that I've been wearing white for a long while, but recent events have inspired me to switch over to black.
Actually, this change to black attire was a recent one. I wore mostly white for a long time, but I experienced a paradigm shift of sorts.
Now, now, better behave yourself, ~catnoir~, or I shall have to take you across my knee.
Come now, ~catnoir~, will you be able to behave yourself or will I have to take you by the ear?
I'd say it's quite flattering, ~catnoir~. I'd hardly say your manner of dress is annoying.

In simplest terms, aether is energy. Magic is simply the manipulation of aether via force of will. Magic necessitates aether, but aether exists on its own. In living things, in natural phenomena and hangs in the air about us.
Of course, purring because I am a Miqo'te. Such poetry...

I'm a student of all things, but my main field or research is aetherology: the study of the latent energy that permeates all things. Where I come from aether is used for a myriad of things, from performing magic to building flying machines.

As a scholar, I've studied a great many things, but my main preoccupation the past few years has been studying aether. 'Tis the ambient energy present in all things, oft harnessed to perform magic or even enable machina to fly.

Aether is my specialty, but 'tis not what brought here specifically. Travel between worlds has been a recent curiosity of mine, so when offered the chance to venture here it appeared to be a good opportunity to gather some information.
Nay, we Miqo'te are unrelated to these PokÃ©mon creatures of your world, Cynthia. Other than the obvious discrepancies, I am exactly the same as you.
I take it there are no Miqo'te where you're from, Cynthia. Believe me, I've more in common with you than any of the PokÃ©mon creatures of your world.
To put it quite plainly, I am not blind. 'Tis true I lost my natural sight in an incident, so I utilize a magicks to see instead.
My eyes? Yes, well, they no longer perceive light as they should, so I employ an arcane method of sight instead.

Aye, I'm not the sole member of my race where I come from. 'Tis passing strange to consider a planet of only female hyurs, or "humans" as you've said. Is yours really the only sentient race where you come from?
So you really don't have Miqo'te, let alone men, where you come from? Eorzea has all sorts of sentient races, even beyond miqo'te like me and hyurs, or "humans," like you.

state.text: "Visit" might not be the right word for my accidental foray into the First, seeing as I was there for a few years. My companions and I managed to escape after an ordeal. The whole thing is such the tale, I hardly know where to start...

case.state: Magic is much like any other talent: ply it well enough and it has all sorts of uses. I'm not doing anything to give myself a preternatural advantage in the game, but just that which allows me to see.

In the spirit of honesty, I must confess that I am employing a bit of magic at the moment. I promise it hasn't given me an advantage over anyone else. I merely require a small enchantment so that I might see.

You really just have to hope for the best, but I'd like to clarify 'tis not my mode of travel. My soul was plucked rather unceremoniously from my body and transferred elsewhere. I wasn't even the intended target.
Ah, I suppose there is some resemblance. Sisters? Yes, I suppose we could be. 'Tis not as far-fetched as all that.
Not all who wear black are in mourning. I started wearing black because I wished to return darkness to a nightless sky.
That would be materia you're seeing. Helps with conducting and controlling aether, as you've surmised. Melding materia is a bit of an archaic practice, but the benefits speak for themselves.
That's... a bizarre assumption to make. I'm compelled to ask what difference you think that would even make?

I'm afraid my work with the Scions of the Seventh Dawn keeps me fairly busy. I hardly have time for outside engagements as it is. 'Tis a tempting offer though. It has been a while since I went out on a proper hunt.

Ah, to know the thrill of the hunt again. 'Tis been quite some time, but sadly I have other pressing engagements with the Scions of the Seventh Dawn. I appreciate the offer, but you'll need to inquire elsewhere.

One's ability to interact and manipulate aether is innate. If one is able to, it all begins with an exertion of their force of will upon the aether within or without them. Focus catalyzes potential energy into action.

Aye, trouble often finds me when I'm not busy finding it, but I can hold my own and better in a fight. Still, mine is a world rife with enough danger that we must all take care not to be caught unawares or alone.
Is it really so strange, the way I speak? 'Tis not considered very formal where I come from. Rather, I've stood accused of being rather brusque at times.
Well, I'm doing naught to be any measure more formal than usual. Passing strange you would say such a thing. Some have said I oft speak much to casually.
You mean Miqo'te, Kaz? Or perhaps you're referring to something else?
With the way this game is played, the odds might be in your favor on that, Kaz.
Not much of a socialite myself, truth be told. I do rub shoulders with the odd leader and noble, but 'tis purely diplomatic.
If I'm not mistaken, black cats bring misfortune on others rather than themselves.
I am merely going at my own pace. I am more accustomed to retaining my modesty rather than shedding it.
Yes, well, 'tis of little importance now that I myself must stand without it...
Mayhap you're right, Kaz, but then again you might be disappointed.
I do believe that would help. I'm sure I'll feel a bit more confident once the ordeal is over.
Oh, a bit of this and a bit of that; I'm a bit of a student of the world. Mostly I study aether and it's practical, or sometimes impractical, applications.
Ah, well, I had an early start. Read a lot of musty books as a child. Though, I'd not gained half the knowledge I have if not for my travels. Life is the best teacher, as it were.
Whatever I lack in years, I make up for in experience. Where the brightest minds are content to remain cooped up in dusty libraries, I've made it a point to hop between dusty libraries.
I'm glad you're impressed, I suppose? They're naught but the features I was born with, I assure you.
I'm half tempted to let you, even if just to see how you react when you find out they're real.
Please do not think I'm here in bad faith, Fina. I just felt compelled to exhaust all my better options before going so far, which is the juncture I find myself at now...
I hail from Sharlayan, though I've made my home in Eorzea. I assure you, my birth is quite common.
Sharlayan was the place of my birth. Though, my origins are quite humble. Any renown I've gained has been done on my own merit.
Is it? Pray tell, what is so strange about it?
Hardly. Miqo'te aren't the most abundant race in Eorzea, but we can still be found throughout the realm.
The easiest way to explain it is to say that they are not really part of my costume.
I'm not a "Erune", thank you. I am a Miqo'te, and naught else.
Well now, seems I can't put one past you.
In some places, no. Not an uncommon sight at all. Those goes for the ears as well as the costume.
I've not come here in bad faith, Noire. I hope you can trust that I have no intention of delaying my fair loss any more than is appropriate.
My ears and tails are not accessories, but a part of my body. I suppose you don't have miqo'te where you come from.
To say they coexist is an understatement. While most societies lean heavily on one or the other, those who combine magic and technology have historically achieved feats considered nigh impossible.

Oh, a bit of conjuration and a bit of thaumaturgy. I have studied black and white magic extensively, but their practice is prohibitively dangerous... for some. With just a few minor alterations, the spells are... well, not harmless or safe, but...
People, like cats, have varying personalities, Noire. 'Tis a bit careless to assume any stereotype about a cat would be true about any miqo'te.
'Tis kind of you to say, but in truth I'm naught more than a pauper. That is to say, I do not have money. Not a single coin.
'Tis an interesting question, if ever I heard one. Mayhap your eyes are merely for show then?

Despite occurrences of exsanguination being attributed to the activity of the undead, investigation always reveals the true culprit to be either voidsent or vilekin, meaning beings of darkness or bugs respectively.
Hm? My apologies, were you talking to me, Mari? I'm afraid I was not listening.
Hm, I suppose it does. This does explain why you were so insistent on the subject. I was very curious why you pushed the issue like you did. I'm glad to have that mystery solved.
'Tis a shame to lose, but at least I can get a bit more comfortable.
Oh good, I can doff more of what it essentially a prison uniform.
Actually, I don't think I'd mind getting some of this off of me...
It's my turn then? Excellent. I have just the discomfort to discard...
No, this loss does not particularly bother me. Have you seen what I'm wearing. I'm not exactly eager to keep it all on.
Ah, well, I'll be more comfortable with a bit less of this anyway.
Hm, well, I've none of those annoying restraints left, but I still find myself a bit stifled...
I should be more bothered by losing here, shouldn't I? I'm just full of surprises this time, aren't I?
My, am I really down to so little? I'd hardly even realized. Passing strange, is it not?
Scraps are hardly a flattering look anyhow.
Oh dear, have I lost? What a tragedy. I'm quite ashamed.
Well, my body is somewhat foreign to me as well. I'll not deny my own curiosity...
Ah, mine is the first loss? Were I superstitious, I might worry what this means for the rest of the game.
My mistake. I had not meant to give you all the impression I could be bested so easily.
Oh, well, so much for getting off to a good start. Mayhap I should tread more carefully from here on out.
Ha, well, I suppose such an early loss may temper my hubris.

Well, clearly my knowledge of Aether has not availed me here. I could tell you all about how it is the elemental energy present in all things and so much more, but I'll have to do it slightly less clothed.

See, if were I blessed with the Echo I might've sensed your cards were better than mine. The Echo 'tis not clairvoyance or telepathy, per se, but it does help one know the hearts and minds of those around them.
I've known Krile a long time, as she is a valued comrade of the Scions, but I can't recall a time she actually used her power to gain an edge in petty games. I don't doubt she'd think it fun to try.

Ah, yes, Lyse. She'll wear short pants and high cut skirts without shame. Mayhap it's merely because pugilists need a full range of movement, but she's certainly less shy about revealing her skin than I.
Tataru, our put upon secretary, has always tried any avenue to procure funds for our organization. I'm unsure she'd fare well gambling on cards, but obviously neither would I.
I'm sure Thancred would be delighted to see me lose here. No other Scion has quite the reputation for being a philanderer. He's a competent spy, but an insufferable flirt.

Speaking of stripping, when I was unceremoniously transported across time and space to The First, a world parallel to my home in The Source, my clothes did not make the journey. 'Twas a most memorable afternoon.
Gods, if Alisae saw me lose like this she'd no doubt take the opportunity to chide me. Even worse would be Alphinaud with his photographic memory. I suppose both twins are trouble.
Obviously, I'm not the card shark of the Scions. In actuality, that would be Urianger. His penchant for theatrics aside, he has a knack for lucky draws.
Oh well, no one is perfect, least of all me.
Ah, there goes my chance at a perfect game. I'll just have to try again later.
I suppose I am in the perfect position to suffer a loss. Well played.
It cannot be helped. I make no complaint about my loss.
I have to concede this round, but I will not be bested so easily.
Well, that is disappointing, but the results are what they are.
Do you intend to dash my hopes of winning with an imposing lead? 'Tis so very callous of you.
I tried, but I suppose we already know I cannot avoid losing a round here or there.
Fie, 'tis frustrating to be the loser of a round.
Even if I am in the lead, to stack losses in this way is a tad unsettling.
'Tis not like I am not taking this seriously. Even if I still lead the pack, I'd rather not continue to lose.
My luck has gotten the best of me it seems. It has been kind so far, but I suppose that could change at any moment.
While I may still be victorious overall, I may still suffer another sort of loss.
Confound it! I'd like to win with my clothes still on if it can be helped.
I suppose if I were behind, I'd try to at least take the leader down with me as well...
Oh, Shtola, you became too complacent with your lead...
Was it too much to pray that my luck could hold up just a mote better than this?
Oh dear... with this loss it no longer feels like I am in the lead...
Oh, delightful...
I admire your persistence, but not more than I dislike losing...
Aye, I most certainly do not feel like I am in the lead anymore...
I've not the mind to comprehend this...
So it's my loss then? Very well, I shall abide by it.
Well, that's too bad. I'd wondered if I could finish this game without stripping.
It cannot be helped. Looks like it's my turn.
Well, seems like this may present a challenge after all.
Aye, I lost again. The challenge is part of the fun, though, so I do not mind so much.
Yes, yes, I see what this means for me. I shall just require a moment to lose my mind.
I lost? Mm, yes, I see. I beg your pardon, but I'd like to have a fit for just a moment.
Oh... well, I suppose my displeasure is evident? Allow me a moment to panic and that shall subside...
I must be missing something. I had expected to do better.
Oh, is it my turn again? This is proving a bit more challenging than I anticipated.
Far be it for me to shrink from a challenge. I know the stakes here, but I'll carry on still.
The situation is beginning to look dicey for me...
I'd hoped to do better than this overall. Mayhap I should be a bit more discerning with my choices.
My luck is not what I hoped it would be. Should I rethink my approach here?
This is not a contingency I had planned for...
Oh, curse my luck! I'd not thought I'd be so hard pressed!
I was so concerned I might lose this hand... mayhap that caused me to err.
Don't panic, Shtola. All is not lost yet...
I'd not mind running low on luck were I not already so pressed for clothing...
I see... so we are sure I lost? Mayhap we could take another minute to examine the cards?
Perhaps I have been too lax, an error I will soon see corrected.
I'd rather not suffer any losses beyond this, but I see now I'll not avoid that fate on prayer alone.
This is troublesome. Mayhap I have been playing too guardedly. Fortune favors the brave, as they say.
I do not care much for losing, but I can at least appreciate the challenge.
You think to put me in my place? I'll have you know I have no intention to continue collecting losses.
Careful, if you continue to compound losses against me, I shall be forced to retaliate.
Down, but not out, as they say. I've half a mind to take this seriously.
Mayhap this is just a spell of bad luck. I do not believe I have aught to worry about presently.
Disappointing, but I'll not argue with the results. I'll not let my luck sour further, I guarantee that.
C-can I possibly ask if there has been some sort of mistake? If not, is it okay if I have a conniption?
Aye, of course. Bear with me as I panic for a spell...
Yes... well... I do hope you will forgive me if I lose my composure for a moment.
Considering what's at stake, perhaps I should endeavor to play more earnestly.
I'm not doing near as well as I hoped. Mayhap I should have a care about how I am playing...
How vexing. Am I simply mired in a bout of poor fortune?
No, no, this won't do at all.
Aye, I have now had my fill of losing hands.
Seems not even careful planning can turn my luck around.
I suppose it wouldn't be sporting of me to bow out simply because I'm on the back foot...
I knew my luck might dip even further, but I had simply prayed it would not...
I knew it would come to this. Luck has been against me from the first, it seems...
So, is this what my misplaced confidence has wrought?
When it rains, oh, how it pours...
The nudity 'tis a bitter pill, aye, but one I can swallow. Losing like this, however, 'tis a sting I'll not tolerate.
Ha, well, I suppose an early loss may temper my hubris.
Aye, there was a disaster. Coerthas was once a verdant forest, but even five years out it has yet to stop snowing. Summer has not yet returned, so they remained gripped in a perpetual icy winter.
To call it a disaster would be an understatement. Coerthas used to be verdant and lush, but 'tis been blanketed in snow these past five years. Summer, let alone spring, eludes them still.
Yes, 'tis quite plain, Bobobo. I'd not thought you'd invite me to such a place without an ulterior motive. Upon your initial proposition, I'd not thought the motive would be this.

Yes... about that. 'Tis plain to me you're currently serving as the vessel for some vast reserve of aether. The ring you wear appears to bind you to it, but 'tis also burning through that selfsame aether to do so.

I can say confidently that Plagg is not purely aether. He may be incorporeal, but he appears to act of his own accord and will. Beings of pure aether are mere puppets, requiring guidance and instructions.
If I had my staff, I'd half a mind to show you more magic than you'd bargained for.
Not to cast doubt on your... powers, but I have my doubts about my hair greeting you in the ancient Ronkan tongue.
To be perfectly honest, I could do without the accompaniment... and I'm quite certain I neither like nor understand this song.
Seems the songs of you world are as bizarre as you are... what is this verse even supposed to be about?
Ah, a "Vision," is it? The tightly packed fire aether did not escape my notice. 'Tis not uncommon practice for the mages of Eorzea to employ similar sorts of crystals in their spellcraft as well.
Then we are both strangers in a strange place. Seems to me no one is from this place. 'Tis some extraordinary tourist trap, a destination for those harboring curiosities of all kinds.

Yes, but the enterprise holds danger as well. It is oft the case that such trips are only one way. Even if you can return, you may find that time has passed differently at home than you yourself experienced.

Aye, that 'twas a sight I'll not soon forget. A vast, sunless sky burning brighter than day, suffused with an impossible amount of light aether. A suffocating blanket of light. I then glanced down and saw I had nary a stitch of clothing...
Just because I am okay with what happens if I lose does not mean I shall be so cavalier with my losses.
I'm more than happy to abide by the rules as long as everyone else is, but that doesn't mean I'll simply strip down to my skivvies after a few losses.
I am well versed in what an idiom is, Bobobo. The issue is I am not aware of that particular idiom.
That is... a shockingly precise definition of an idiom, at least coming from you, Bobobo. Regardless, the particular idiom you used isn't one I've encountered.
... Your compliance is fueled by the most inappropriate of intentions. Mayhap you should jeer a little so I can at least know your mind.
I sincerely doubt that. I'm sure once my socks are off you'll be back to your usual ways. Could I ask that you try and refrain by a measure?
Don't let my sour mood ruin your fun. I'm sure you're spoiling to make some untoward comment now that my body will be on display...
Twelve forbid, but mayhap it is that your madness is rubbing off on me...
Oh dear, I hope your brand of madness hasn't rubbed off on me...

state.text: {small}Because who wouldn't panic a bit when getting naked in front of strangers? I mean one moment I'm minding my own business in the Hinterlands and the next I'm talking to a strange man with an afro who has me climb inside his head on the promise of uncovering the secrets of traveling between worlds and speaking of uncovering I should probably get this off!{!reset}

case.state: Considering my growing losses, ~catnoir~, I'd not mind were you all to lose focus. Might make finishing this game out without reveling much else more likely.
'Tis not an uncommon practice to use crystals for such things. Even a small fire aspected shard can keep a stove running long enough to make a meal. Engineers buy up larger shards to power machinery.
Indeed, we do use them as a source of energy. 'Tis a long standing practice, actually. Forges, alembics, and other apparatus tradesmen use are fashioned to use crystals as a source of power.
Unfortunately, I've not truly restored my sight. I merely emulate sight by heightening my sensitivity to aether. For most things, 'tis the same as natural sight, but there are drawbacks...

I'm afraid my solution is not a cure. Since I can no longer see by means of light, I have instead heightened my sensitivity to aether to see. 'Tis not unlike how I could see before, save for a few limitations...
Outside of appearance, we aren't all that different. On the whole, we are no stronger, no faster, no more intelligent, nor are we any better at magic.

I understand why you think there might be some difference, but there really isn't. My people are just as strong, just as fast, and just as intelligent as the rest. We're just as good at fighting and using magic as well.
Can't say I've heard tale of any Miqo'te, or anyone else, venturing that far from our star in the first place. We also don't refer to our star as "Earth," but rather "The Source" or "Hydaelyn."
We may be even more distant than that. For one thing, we've not historically referred to our star as "Earth." We merely refer to it as "The Source" or "Hydaelyn."
Yes, well, I'm sure that's why they say "blood is thicker than wool."

Not entirely, no. A number of my fellow Scions of the Seventh Dawn are students of the very subject. Others are ... challenged in such academic arenas. There is an understanding that the subject is oft best left to me alone.

That's an interesting sentiment, Nami. Some of Eorzea's greatest scholars were students of magecraft and the arcane. Many of our oldest and most vaunted of orders were started by mages. Mayhap this is strange to you?
Goodness, where does one begin explaining all that? The liberation of Ala Mhigo? The incursion by the Warriors of Darkness? The expedition into the Crystal Tower? 'Tis a bit of a tale...

The underlying mechanisms are difficult to understand, even for those regularly acquainted with aether. Mayhap 'twas a blessing that I was more than familiar with the underlying theories before I lost my sight.
I had lost my sight, but not my intellect. I'd studied aether for nearly my whole life, and now I must rely on it to see. 'Tis fine comedy, nearly.
Ah, so that's what you're getting at. Fear not, for as long as someone or something has even a scruple of aether comprising it, I can perceive it's form well enough.
How did I know? Personally? A series of small fires.
An interesting question. I take pride in all the victories my companions and I have accomplished, but looking back I feel particularly proud of our triumph in the Ravel over Eros...

Strangely enough, the trial that comes to mind is the battle against Alexander. It seemed as if our efforts only mired us deeper peril, so to come out the other end victorious against all odds was reassuring.

Hm, a victory that stands out to me? My skirmish against the Oronir with Lord Hien stands out, mayhap not because I am proud of it but because Magnai had the audacity to propose to me before the dust had settled.
I can't imagine you possibly mean me. If you desire to persevere, you'll have to do so on your own merits.
