So you don't have many peers back home, at least when it comes to magic? I can imagine that might make one feel a bit lonesome.
The realm wants for change and succor, and both must needs come from those in power. 'Tis the duty of the Scions to compel those with the power to affect change to fulfill their responsibilities.
I didn't finger you as the superstitious type, Kaz. Nor so concerned with cats...
I must confess to being more curious than I am bold, but you're not wrong. Chalk it up to a lack of experience on my part.
Aye, but remember me for what? The dress... or something else?
Bold or not, 'tis the only pragmatic move. I can still cover myself with one hand this way.

state.text: Demon is oft used to refer to a classification of monster more commonly known as a voidsent. Voidsents are not of our world, but instead populate a world apart from ours known only as "The Void." They are beings of pure darkness fixated on infiltrating our world and drowning it in the selfsame darkness that permeates their own...

Popular fashion in Eorzea has always been dominated by the practical, as is to be expected by a realm besieged by calamity and warfare. Attention to find clothes is normally reserved to those of wealth and means, but there is still a burgeoning scene of independent weavers and leather workers directly answering the demand for clothes that bridge the practical with the pleasant.

Chocolate making in Eorzea dates back to the early days of Hyurian settlers arriving in La Noscea. They harvested kukuru beans from the cliff sides on the lower shores, crushing them to combine the ground beans with the oil inside. Sugar, milk, and other flavoring is added and then kneaded into a paste which is tempered continuously until the desired consistency and structure is obtained. Merchants from Thanalan and local kobolds were eager to trade other, more practical sundries for the treat, establishing the kukuru bean as a staple crop in the region along with oranges, grapes, and olives.

case.state: Simply put, aether is energy. 'Tis what comprises all things and makes us up: mind, body, and memory.
If I wasn't prepared, I would not have come so far. Even so, I find myself terribly nervous. I am... unaccustomed to such situations.
You're not wrong, but I try to avoid anyone interested in me solely for that reason. Their intentions are always less than noble...
Even back home, 'tis best to avoid any men interested in me because of my Miqo'te features. They always have... certain expectations...
Y'shtola. Y-S-H-T-O-L-A. Does that help?
Vampires? Nay, not outside of folklore. Seems silly to imagine such creatures when there are actual voidsent that present an actual threat. Does no good to chase such phantoms.

Gods, 'tis not like I should ever forget any of the places I've been nor the trials I've undergone. I doubt even my own retelling could convey the fullness of it all, but no matter how much time passes it all still feels so very present in my mind.
Fie, I scarcely know where to begin with that. I shall be quite old indeed before the memory of anything I've seen or done fades from my mind.
Perhaps you're right, but there is no empirical evidence to suggest that. Not one documented specimen. Not one credible account. Not even an entertaining fictional account worth noting.
More than some, less than others. I'm more of an academic than an acrobat, I'm afraid.
Of course. We shall have to throw out all the history books for they shall be naught but a footnote after the discovery of... half a vampire.
I can move it as naturally as I move my arm or leg and it's purpose is to help with balance. I'm not particularly acrobatic myself, but I can sprint in heels without making a fool of myself.
I'd not discourage you, but my home can be a tumultuous place. 'Tis not all lace, ribbons, and men dressed as giant hares.
Some cats do not mind the water so much, but 'tis a moot point seeing as I am not a cat myself. Miqo'te are no more or less partial to the water than any other race of men.
One would assume such, and some records seem to suggest as much; however, naught remains of these technologies. Most of what survives was developed for martial purposes.

I assure you I have my magicks well under control... though, there is one spell in my repertoire that has backfired on me before. The consequences were not "cataclysmic," I just lost the use of my eyes is all.
Having never encountered a Miqo'te, I suppose your naivete could be forgiven. Admittedly, yours is a more flattering stereotype than people back home generally hold about Miqo'te.
'Twould not be the first time we'd been ripped from our home world and assisted by a hooded compatriot. Do remember you made this offer when I arrive on your doorstep.
If such a thing were going to happen to anyone, 'twould likely be us... again. Do not be shocked if I have need to take you up on that offer.
'Tis a bit hot for a black dress, but I would rather be hot than... undressed.
No, I am not glad to be rid of this dress despite the heat. Especially since you will see that I am... sweaty.
I'm a Miqo'te; I can handle the heat. What I am less able to handle is standing about in my unmentionables.
Wonderful, now I can freeze while I become a spectacle.
The idea of being so exposed frightens me, but should you see me shiver just know 'tis because this place is bitterly cold...
Miqo'te do not do well with cold. I do not do well with being undressed. Understand that this greatly displeases me.

{small}I-I guess we're all girls here... b-but still, I wouldn't want to flash you all all... all of a sudden? Right? None of you would want that except you are here playing strip poker so maybe you wouldn't mind so much but I wouldn't dream of assuming such a thing about such a nice group of ladies, no, not ever.{!reset}

{small}Very well, I suppose I should take my bra off then. Aye, 'tis not that big of a deal. We're all women here. Not like everyone here hasn't seen a woman's breasts before, I mean, at least their own breasts? Maybe others? Maybe even here? Not mine though, probably, right? I'm Y'shtola, if you forgot. Y'shtola Rhul. Nice to meet you?{!reset}

{small}I would really rather not being doing this in front of a bunch of men, but I did agree to play and far be it from me to go back on my word or back down from a challenge although I never actually did give my word although there must be some tacit agreement made when I start playing and if I go back on that I am "welching" I believe is the term. "Welching?"{!reset}

{small}Why did I have to play so poorly when the only other players are men I mean there is not even one other woman here usually you can't walk five feet around this place without running into a woman but somehow I ended up by myself at a table of men and now my bra is coming off and I simply mustn't allow them to see my nnn... mmm... no...{!reset}
I wonder if the waters about The Inventory have fish in them. If so, are they native fish or visitors like us? Might be worth studying.

I asked one of my fellow scions what ~player.ifMale(he|she)~ likes to do in the summertime and I was surprised to hear ~player.ifMale(he|she)~ likes to go fishing. Apparently ~player.ifMale(he|she)~ is very good at it.
When I was in the Rak'tika Greatwood, I told Runar I missed the fresh fish caught in summer from back home. He tried to catch me a fish as a result, but wound up empty handed and soaked.
In traditional Seeker of Sun Miqo'te society, Valentione's Day is not really recognized. Not much room for love in a society with designated breeding males.
'Tis nice to be able to celebrate Valentione's Day a bit this year. Last year I was trapped in a different world for three years, and they did not celebrate it there.
There are those who seek out Love Potions for this day. They are all scams for you can't inspire devotion via alchemy. No, 'twould be better to ply your intended's aether directly.
Bringing me down to three losses deserves some sort of reward, does it not? How about an unimpeded view of my eyes?
Very well, I shall doff my sunglasses next. I think they make me look rather sophisticated, but perhaps you would rather see my eyes more clearly.
It may not seem all that much, but with my sunglasses gone my emotions will be more clear upon my face. I promise the difference will be quite profound.
You know, I've spent a lot of time in La Noscea, but I never get a chance to really enjoy the beaches there. Always a call to make with no time for sunbathing.
I've spent plenty of time on the beaches of La Noscea. Soft sand, clear waters, murderous jellyfish. Not to mention disgruntled kobolds and qiqirn looking for eggs.
The most famous beach in La Noscea is called "The Bloodshore." The story behind the name is unpleasant, and oft so is the place itself. The sunsets are lovely, though.
So much for a relaxing vacation. I've naught but my bathing suit beneath this, and just the thought of showing it off is making me nervous...
'Tis a shame to part with my lei. It made me really feel like I was on vacation on top of blocking the view of my bathing suit.
I did not come here on vacation to show off my bathing suit, mind you. I just thought it... appropriate.
Gods, the top of this bathing suit is revealing enough. The bottom piece is... well, you'll soon see for yourself.
I had hoped I would not need to take this off, but I suppose I saw this coming. Oh dear...
Seems I shall be reduced to just my bathing suit. Not exactly the same as standing around in my pants, yet somehow I feel naught a bit of difference...
R-right, so I'll remove my bottom next. 'Tis not like my hand cannot do a better job than this piece of cloth.
If I'm determined to win, then I've no choice but to remove my bottom. 'Tis not like I must allow you to see what is underneath.
If you're all resolved to stare at my exposed body, then I do hope you enjoy seeing the back of my hand.

state.text: {small}Okay... if I block my bottom half with my leg and I can use both hands to-woah, steady, Shtola! If you fall over now all your bits are going to be flying all over this place and we do not need that, no that is the last thing we need! Just take it easy and untie the back of your top nice and slow and nice... and... slow...{!reset}

{small}W-wait! How am I going to, without-wait! Wait! W-wait? Oh no... no, no, no... maybe if I... just real quick... untie the back and then-but if I let it fall and move my other hand you'll all see my aaaah-wait, wait, wait... wait! I can do this I just need to think for a second about this r-rationally.{!reset}

case.state: We have Lady Lisette of House Valentione to thank for Valentione's Day's popularity. Each year she descends from Ishgard onto Eorzea at large to coerce confessions of love from her people.
There would be no Valentione's Day without Lady Lisette. Of everyone in House Valentione, she is by far the most insistent upon recognizing this day of ardor and affection. Most Insistent indeed.
Valentione's Day was once a more muted affair, but thanks to Lady Lisette it seems to grow more ostentatious with each passing year. And I'm not just talking about the decorations...
House Valentione did have some dresses among their offerings. Lacy things with lots of hearts and the like. Not exactly my taste.
I had considered getting a dress from House Valentione, but upon seeing them I realized they weren't exactly my style, as it were. I did think this ensemble was rather sharp though.

Gaudy dresses adorned with hearts are... well, not much to my taste. Still, I wanted to get something from House Valentione to mark the day, so I went with these instead. Actually, I'm quite satisfied with my decision.
I am accustomed to being "alone" on Valentione's Day. Some make a whole deal out of it. Obviously the constant reminders of love and ardor make them feel more lonely. 'Tis easy enough to understand.
Though Valentione's Day does bring out the hopeless romantic in many people, it in others it just emphasizes the hopeless part.
Tragically, the arrival of Valentione's Day makes some a little desperate to find someone to spend it with. If you ask me, 'tis not really a healthy place to begin a relationship.
Fie, I could be doing better. I had distracted myself for a bit, but I find my mind wandering again. 'Tis so strange. The day did not used to...
Apologies, I am trying to focus. I got away from Eorzea to perhaps banish these thoughts, but even here... I just...
I do confess to being a bit mixed-up at the moment. I was sure being here would be manic enough to keep my thoughts from straying, but even so...
No need to concern yourselves about me, now that I'm this exposed I'm feeling rather clear-headed. And yes, I do that that preferable. Honestly!
I'll admit to having a slight case of being worked up over this holiday. It's certainly... different than years past, that's for sure.

So I'm a little distracted today, as you may have surmised. Talking about it that little, tiny bit did help. I mean, I'm not cured by any stretch of the imagination, but it does feel like a weight off, at least.
Well, off with the lot of it, I suppose. I've gotten this far, so no sense in killing he momentum. Besides, as long as I still have this shirt I'm plenty covered.
It may not be very pragmatic, but I'll just have to remove the lot of it. Half measures won't suffice, not at this point. A little exercise in bravery, we shall call it.
I could probably stretch this out a bit more, but I will eschew my usual pragmatism for now. I could, mayhap, benefit from practicing a bit of brazenness.

state.text: {small}Just to be perfectly transparent this is my own shirt that I own. I'm not wearing some man's shirt. I've not cleaved to it for sentimental reasons or anything. 'Tis only that it kept me covered quite well and it just made sense to keep it around. I just don't want there to be any confusion about it, is all. There's nothing strange going on here, I assure you. Yes, I very much assure you.{!reset}

case.state: If I must strip down to my bathing suit, mayhap I should just go for a swim after this. I've not taken a swim for my leisure for quite some time.
If I end up in just my bathing suit, mayhap a bit of a swim would not go amiss. 'Tis summer after all and I've not taken a vacation in ages.
A part of me hoped I might take a swim where The Inventory lets out to an ocean. 'Tis rare I find a secluded beach not overrun with giant crabs.
This is the time of year we celebrate Hatching-tide in Eorzea. A pleasant little holiday to welcome in spring. After a tough winter, 'tis nice to have reason to celebrate.
The entry of spring into Eorzea is marked by the celebration of Hatching-tide. Life in Eorzea can be rough, so we celebrate when we can.
While life in Eorzea can be harsh and uncertain, her citizens don't hold back when time for festivities roll around. When spring begins, we celebrate Hatching-tide.
Oh, yes, I suppose I should address my transformation. In all the excitement, I nearly forgot.
Ah, I knew I was forgetting something. Mayhap now is a good chance to clear up my transformation.
So, you're likely wondering why I look like this. Now is a good a time as ever to explain this transformation.
There are plenty of people in Eorzea who were not born into the bodies they currently possess. Transformations so perfect you'd never know they took place.
While I plan on changing back, there are some who transform and remain that way. Sometimes more than once, or even twice.
The process that transformed me will also change me back quite easily, but of course there are some who transform like this with no intention of changing back.
Oh dear. Balancing like this is far more difficult without my tail...
Now just to-oh, oh my! Oh, confound it. I can hardly balance without my tail!
Ah, oh no! Maybe I shouldn't be doing this without my tail...
I was hoping this transformation would instill a little more courage in me, or at least a bit of detachment from the situation...
Even if this is just a temporary form, to bear it all is just as embarrassing... maybe even moreso...
One would think to reveal a body other than their own wouldn't be so embarrassing, but here I am just as red in the face as ever...
'Tis a shame. I've always though these bunny outfits the waitresses wear were cute. Wearing one was fun while it lasted.
I was hoping to wear this outfit a little longer. 'Tis not like I will have frequent occasion to don it. At least it was fun while it lasted.
And I so did like this outfit. It was fun while it lasted, but I'm grateful to have at least one occasion to wear it.
Normally I might try to obscure your view with my leg, but standing on one leg without my tail is... well, it would be far more embarrassing to expose myself while falling on my face.
I'm doing an awful lot of sitting on the floor today. If I had my tail I could at least stand up for this. Still, this is far less embarrassing than toppling over onto my naked rear would be.
Since falling over while taking my pants off would be mortifying beyond my comprehension, I shall just sit on the floor for this part. It'd be hard to balance for this without my tail...

state.text: {small}At least today I've learned a valuable lesson about being comfortable in my own skin, quite literally as it were. I keep thinking, "wouldn't you be more comfortable in your old, familiar body?" And I think I would. Even with these ears and without my tail, I am still a miqo'te. Changing for one day has been fun, but I've had enough fun for one Hatching-tide. If I lose my tail again somehow, it will be too soon! {!reset}

case.state: I suppose I should explain a bit. I'm just in the middle of an experiment. I'm sure the details would bore you, but it involves a large quantity of light aspected aether and an artificial sin eater.
I'm sure this form is... well, alarming without context. 'Tis just a little experiment to have my body accommodate a large quantity of light aether via an artificial sin eater.
My current appearance is no reason for alarm. Just the result of flooding my body with light aspected aether using an artificial sin eater of my own creation.
No attachment to this. I suppose I'll just do away with the bits I do not require.
Concrete and steel were ill suited to hold me back, so hempen cloth should be no issue.
This thing is unbearably itchy. Pardon me for just a moment.
Why did I put these on so tight, anyway? Safety, I guess. Surprised the wall broke before these did. Stubborn things...
Mm, resilient little things. Too tight to squeeze over my hand. Guess I'll have to...
I suppose these were for the safety of myself and everyone else, but did I have to put them on so tight? Rrgh, come on...
Ahem, well, I will now very calmly and without incident undo the very simple buckle on my leg restraints. That is what a person not drunk on power would do...
I suppose I could have just undone the buckle on my wrist restraints instead of tearing them off like that. I assure you, I am still capable of behaving calmly and rationally. Here, let me show you.
While tearing off my clothes like an animal is all good fun, I suppose I should not overindulge. I'll just undo the buckle like the regular, level-headed person I usually am.
This is not a fashion statement, mind you. I created this to act as the catalyst for my transformation. An artificial sin eater to borrow aether from. Preferable to the real thing by a long shot.

This, while a tad ostentatious, is my artificial catalyst for the transformation. Simply absorbing that much aether all at once myself would basically kill me. To oversimplify things, using this is like borrowing aether.

My headgear was actually the catalyst for this transformation. A living body cannot sustain so much aether all at once, at least not without some assistance. I could go on and on explaining, but I'll refrain.
Now, I can likely remove this without breaking it. I didn't bring the key with me, but I can probably just... hmm... just...
Okay, I can be civil about this. I don't need to rip it apart, I can just... well I can't unlock it without the key. Can't slip it over my head, so maybe I'll just... uh... just...
Hmm, how to get this off without breaking it. No key to unlock it and I can't fit my head through it either. Well, maybe I could if I sort of... just...
Fascinating... seems I've more than a little loss of inhibition. I do wonder how far it will go.
Aside from an appetite for aether and destruction, seems there's another hunger I've picked up.
'Tis not often I find myself so freed of my inhibitions. I hold my liquor quite well, I should say.
Guess I shall save this. I may require it later when I return home.
This red uniform is traditional for the Starlight Celebrations. Thousands of adventurers don them to help in preparations for the big night.
If you're wondering about my attire, 'tis a tradition around this time. It harkens back to the red uniforms of those we began the traditions we still celebrate today.
I know these clothes are a bit ostentatious, but they are in the spirit of the season, I assure you. The red cloak holds special meaning to the festivities of the Starlight Celebration.

I've been pondering what sort of present would be fitting for our esteemed Warrior of Light. It seems there is very little he wants for, even though he seems to want every little wayward chip of bone and drop of sap he comes across.

I'm quite certain I know what sort of gifts my fellow Scions would be happy with, save for our esteemed Warrior of Light. I honestly have no idea what it is he'd want and it seems like it may be too late to simply ask.

I find myself slightly vexed trying to come up with a suitable present for our esteemed Warrior of Light. He has an inherent curiosity about everything, it seems, but that just makes it difficult to discern what it is he actually enjoys.
The holly is a traditional sign of the season. 'Tis evergreen, keeping its leaves and growing bright red berries even in the dead of winter. It gives us hope that we too will endure the coming cold.

Here's a bit of trivia: holly trees are evergreen. Even as winter comes, they remain green and produce their red berries. Their striking appearance and endurance has made them a symbol for the season.
The evergreen holly is an enduring symbol of the season. For centuries, its green boughs and red berries have ever been symbolic of thriving during the coldest months.
I do not think I am particularly materialistic. 'Tis nice to receive gifts, but honestly I haven't much need for things. The things I want are oft intangible.
Honestly I do not have much need for material things. I do like receiving gifts, but I've little time to enjoy such things. No, mostly I want for things that one cannot hold in their hand.

The exchanging of gifts is a nice enough tradition, but personally I don't really have too much use for material things. Even things I like are oft consigned to collect dust while I busy myself with more pressing matters.
All these layers are a bit much considering we're not standing about in the snow. I suppose it will feel god to get these off...
I was more suitably dressed for being out in the elements of a winter's day, so right now this is all a bit much. I even put on my good woolen tights.
As much as I value my modesty, I am overheating quite a bit. All this wool doesn't exactly breath very well...
I don't suppose there's a way to get this off over my head without looking like a fool, is there?
Excuse me a moment. There's not really a dignified way to get this off over my head.
Not sure I can pull this over my head without looking like I've been caught in a bag for a moment...
I like you all well enough, but after all of this you'd best not be expecting any sort of gift from me.
Can we all agree this counts as a gift and that I've displayed the most generous spirit towards you all this season?
In lieu of actual gifts, we'll just say this counts as a present to you all. I'm sure my generosity will be much talked about...
I suppose I'll start with my necklace. Not terribly exciting, I know, but let's just call me a "stripping pragmatist."
My necklace then? I'm rather fond of it, but it seems like the logical choice. Why go overboard when I lost just one round?
My necklace will suffice, won't it? You'll get a better view of my neck this way. As I understand it, there are those who like such things.
So little time passed in the Source compared to how long I lingered in the First. When I returned, my old clothes seemed alien to me.
I began dressing in this manner after spending time with the Night's Blessed in the First. I was with them so long, I forgot what my clothes back in the Source even looked like.
If you think my manner of dress peculiar, I must confess it is not native to my true home; however, after lingering in the First, this just feels right.
I got the original version of these from Runar, a member of the Night's Blessed. When I was in the first, they were like my family.
My new manner of dress is thanks in part to my time spent with the Night's Blessed. When I was a stranger in the First, they took me in.
The Night's Blessed were very fond of their feather adornments. I was given these, so I affixed them to my hair. I've grown fond of the look much like I grew fond of Night's Blessed.
This dress makes taking my boots off difficult, or at least difficult if I desire not to let you all see up my skirt.
I should be able to get these off without giving you all a peek up my skirt...
Oof, well, there's one. This would be easier were I not so sure you'd all look up my skirt if given the chance.
The boots were one thing, my socks on the other hand... well, give me a moment.
Fine, fine, my socks will go next. This is not another chance to see up my dress.
I'll remove my socks next, clearly. I have no designs to remove my dress if I don't have to.
I'll not have you all thinking I'm playing in bad faith. When I win, I'll have done so quite fairly!
I suppose I could simply bow out after this, but playing and winning will be all the more fun now that I'm fired up.
I've no intentions to lose again after this. You may count upon that. I'm feeling more motivated than before.
The rules are only that I have to take off my clothes, not that I must show you anything beneath them.
Fine. My pants will come off, but don't think I'll let you see anything of consequence.
Though I must strip, the rules do not compel me to allow you to see anything beneath.

{small}Okay... now I need raise my arms, pull my bra off over my head, and then lower my arms back down before anyone spots anything unbecoming. That should be possible, right? Maybe I should turn a-no! They'd see my behind if I did that. Best to move swiftly before they can react... this plan isn't crazy r-right? Right?{!reset}

{small}W-wait! How am I going to, without-wait! Wait! W-wait? Oh no... no, no, no... maybe if I... just real quick... over my head and then-but if I lift my other hand you'll all see my aaaah-wait, wait, wait... wait! I can do this I just need to think for a second about this r-rationally.{!reset}
'Tis not like being in my drawers would be any better, but being here in a bathing suit simply adds to the embarrassment...
Why here? And why while I am in my bathing suit? I feel so out of place...
If my manner of dress had not yet tipped you off, playing here was clearly not my idea...
I would not worry overmuch since this place seems safe enough. I've not had any trouble going back and forth, though I do have to solicit another's help to travel to and fro.
Ah, 'twas not my intention to alarm you. The Inventory seems safe enough. I cannot travel to and fro from here unaided, but there have been no complications that I've encountered.

I'm not entirely unconvinced that ~player~ doesn't belong to this world; ~player.ifMale(he|she)~ is here often enough. I cannot go to or from this place without assistance, but even so I've never had any trouble doing so.

Well, 'tis perfectly inhabitable now. Surely if the denizens of this star saw their world was in decline, they would rally together and find a solution. No cause could be so equally self-serving and altruistic.

Coerthas may be cold now, but those who live there are all the more emboldened by it. Seems if a place is one's home, there is naught they will do to either preserve it or remain there. I'm sure this star is no exception.
Couldn't help yourself, could you?
Fie, you nearly managed to fend that one off, didn't you?
Ha, I'm glad you got that one out. You looked as though your head might explode.
I feel quite a measure better now, and also out of breath? Quite the rush, I must say.
Well, I think my heart is going a malm a minute, but otherwise I'm rather exhilarated.
Hm, yes, quite better now. Though, all this excitement might be bad for my health.
Well, seems there may yet be a brain somewhere in that vacuous coiffure of yours.
Now you're catching on, Bobobo. Mayhap your hair has not fully suffocated your brain.
He must have some sort of core or soul keeping his power in check because with the amount of aether Plagg contains he would consuming the ambient aether from his surroundings, including us.

Aye, and what is done at this convocation of worlds? They would have us play this bawdy game and ogle one another. Quite asinine, really; however, 'tis obvious I'm not above an interest in such things.
Yes, well... one's soul has no clothes. When it goes hither and thither, it does so without vestments. I know this better than most... unfortunately...
Oh, 'twas the end of things and 'twas beginning of things. 'Tis not the only state we liberated that week either.
If naught else, their plight was the chief reason behind the entire ordeal. Theirs was a world in need of salvation, and we had just the savior.
Ha, mayhap I've no need to explain that part for you. You seem to have the right of it already.
Possibly, but 'tis also said those favored by the gods could hear the ancients whispering it in the Greatwood. For you to be hearing it now... oh, it's probably nothing.
I'll not deny that. In the end, I'd not be playing if I did not wish to. Suffice it to say, I'm curious about more than just the Inventory itself.
Well, beyond just investigating the Inventory, I'd like to investigate the people here. Where they come from, who they are, what lies beneath their trousers...
I'd never had such an experience before I visited the dwarven settlements and I've not had one since. I imagine you're not stranger to difficulties with doors with that hairstyle of yours.
The homes of the dwarves had small doors and small ceilings within. 'Twas most bizarre to stoop down and look in their little windows.
Besides, isn't the anticipation part of the fun? The allure? I was under the impression that men enjoyed being teased.
I was made to believe a bit of anticipation made the proceedings here more worthwhile. Isn't the build-up what makes this game so stimulating to play?
I'm sure if you just wanted to see a naked girl, there are other places you can go. Why come here if you're not wanting to experience the anticipation and risk?
Well, of course I say "popoto." Why would anyone say "potato?"
You've lost me again. I'm guessing this "potato" is maybe like a popoto?
Oh, come now. That can't be an idiom. I'm plainly sure "potato" isn't a word.
That's... thank you, but I'm resolved to stay. I'm not free of impure motives of my own...
A mild comfort... but not one I'm ungrateful for. I'll stick around, of course. 'Tis not like my own motives are pure...
Yes, well, I appreciate the concern, ~catnoir~. I'm resolved to see this through to the end, although I may not do so with much bravado...

"Paksis?" This isn't a term I've encountered in my studies. As far as aether is concerned, if you had enough you could power a vessel to cross the sky, sea, and even quite possibly the stars as you say.

Can't say I've ever heard the term "Paksis." Though, if 'tis a condensed, crystalline energy source it may be possible they are selfsame. It's certainly feasible that an aether-powered vessel could navigate the stars.
Oh, well, I suppose we're different in that regard as well. Apologies, but hyurs like you where I come from are able to be mages just as easily as anything else.
I suppose we should chalk up one more difference, if that's the case. The hyurs like you that I've known are perfectly able to learn spellcraft if they've the notion to try.
Ah, well, the drawbacks are nothing to be concerned about. My visual range doesn't stretch all the way to the horizon, but as there is always aether present I have excellent night vision.

In order to see this way... no, the constant presence of aether makes it quite viable. Large quantities of light aspected aether can make it difficult to see, but natural ambient aether lets me see perfectly well.
'Tis true, even from age to age the star has gone by a different name. Mayhap your kind are related to the Allagans. They certainly had the technology to venture out into space.
A fair point. Mayhap your ancestors came from an age before ours. 'Tis possible you're descended from Allagans. They're the only ones I can think of capable of traversing the stars.
Aye, 'tis more likely we actually do share blood than anyone has ever actually used such a turn of phrase.
I'm merely putting you on. There is no such expression and we're likely not sisters. The latter is not impossible, but it seems improbable.
It matters not if 'tis a burden. At least when I handle these things, I can be comforted in the notion that they will be done right.

I can understand the sentiment. I'm sure there are some such commonplace things in your world that would be just as outlandish to me. Do let it be said that I would not be adverse to hearing about any of them.
At least as far as card games are concerned, we are on even footing. I've no ability to gaze through cards or clothes, for better or worse.
'Tis really nothing to concern yourself over. Very seldom am I ever hindered by the loss of my natural sight thanks to the magicks I employ.
Seems passing strange that there is such a disparity between our worlds. Your aether doesn't appear any less dense than my own, but perhaps you are the exception and not the rule. Very curious.
Ha! Mayhap it is a tad poetic, but that is nonetheless what we set out to achieve.
A bold proposition, but I fear I must decline. We must both rise or fall by the merits of our own fortune, but I do wish you what luck I can spare.
No, no, your actual intentions are quite clear, believe me. Besides, I've been called far worse that just "cat."

The magic of another world would be a fascinating subject for me, should you require someone to talk to. I promise I won't let it be all business, but you must understand my interest is mostly academic.

Bit of an odd confession, Kaz. I was under the impression you were trying to flirt with me. This admission of your shortcoming is... actually, a bit refreshing? Dear me, you might know what you're doing...
Always the flatterer. Perhaps I can understand why the women of your world are so keen on you.
That you could say such saccharine drivel so easily...
Kaz Kaan! You... you frustrate me!
Still a bit nervous, a little light-headed from talking so much, but still having fun. This is not the sort of excitement I'm accustomed to.
Oh, sorry, you asked if I like chocolate. Not particularly, too sweet.
I'm not sure about relaxing, but at the very least it might be distracting.
I'm not sure if that would help, Robin; however, I sense you may just be angling for a chance to touch my ears.
Mutual? Hardly. I've no fantastical ideas about romance, but knowing my betrothed for more than five minutes would be, I think, ideal.
Difficult, sure. Important, absolutely. It sticks out in my mind more than anything because it meant I finally kept my promise to bring night back to the Great Wood.
It felt as if fate was conspiring against us, but in the end 'twas only a parlor trick. The most baffling of enigmas, resolved by a temperamental kitten...
Then mayhap we'd benefit from comparing notes. Though, this may not be the proper venue for such discourse...
There's naught I can do about that, I'm afraid. 'Tis the only name I have to give.
In a place like this though, who knows what one might encounter.
I've not counted out the possibility, Mari. The main issue is that I cannot be bothered to seek confirmation either way.

Unfortunately I'm not in the habit of keeping a written log of my travels, but the thought has crossed my mind; however, I fear any notes I should try and keep on my person might inevitably be destroyed during combat...

I've done well enough relying solely on my own recollection. I have thought that I should commit a log of my travels to paper, but I nary have time to do so before I find myself embroiled in some new conflict.
Well, at least the floor is not sticky. At least, where my feet are at the moment is not sticky. I'm still a bit fearful of taking a step.
Well, I guess there's no avoiding dirtying my feet now.
Sand is a bit hot for bare feet, to be honest. Perhaps if I dig my feet in, I can find some cooler sand...
If I lose much else, I'll be up on this roof in naught but my bathing suit. 'Tis not a situation I expected to be facing...
This is certainly not the venue I expected to be playing on when I wore this...
Well, at least the grass is pleasant neath my feet. A "silver lining," as they say.
Okay, the floor is ice cold. ~Player~, had I known you would invite me to such a place I'd have worn my usual attire...
Yes... well... I didn't really own a bathing suit. I asked Lyse to help me pick one out and she... well, she may have twisted my arm some...
Gods, why did I ask Lyse to help me find a bathing suit? I should have just asked Tataru to make one. She would have made it... bigger...
It beggars belief that Lyse called this "tastefully modest." She spoke such words of praise when I wore it that I... forgot to object...
I'd like to reiterate that I am on vacation, relaxing. I am wearing this for my leisure, not so you might ogle me.
Lyse said it would be a shame to wear a bathing suit and not show it off. For the record, I disagree with that sentiment.
There, now I am in my bathing suit proper. If I have my way, this shall be all of me you chance to see.
It's just that we were apart for so long, but we're back together and safe for the moment. Is it... so mad that we could explore what could be? Even just briefly? To be happy fools for a day?

It's only that I could not fathom it, when he reappeared... how my heart raced. How it still pounds in the scant few moments we have to ourselves. I ponder, in my greed, what could be if we had just a few more...

I feel so foolish, but after all this time of drawing upon his strength, I didn't realize what was stirring. As I watched him bear the world in his arms, I wondered: if he were to lay it down, could I fill that space?
Obviously, I could stand to build up my courage a bit more. In matters of the heart, I am still a student.
Regrettably for you, now that I've somewhat regained my composure I shall be clearing this task without further mistakes. Nothing personal, 'tis just good sense.
So, no need for extra consideration for me. I am perfectly capable of putting the lot of you in your proper place, as it were! It will be quite fun, I guarantee!
Even so, being like this has been... fun. 'Tis so strange and exciting. Still, I'll likely heave a sigh of relief when I wake back up in my own body.
But this experience is so new, to be like this. 'Tis hard to articulate, but it's exhilarating. Though, I imagine waking back up in my own body will still be a relief.
My, what a day. Confusing and thrilling in equal measure. I'll be glad to return to normal, but this has certainly been an experience.
I mean, let's be honest. Would anyone take me seriously if I dressed like that all the time? I don't think I would...
For someone to be dressed in such an outfit all the time, it's hard to conceive of. If one is to help the realm, they must dress the point.
Even if it were somehow appropriate to dress like this more often, I don't know if I would. I'd like to be taken seriously above all else.

And it's inert now... just a piece of fragile crystal that I will not smash into a million tiny pieces on the ground. Even if it would be fun and satisfying, I am level headed and able to refrain because I am not drunk with power.
See, if I were drunk on power I would smash this now useless piece of crystal on the floor. The thought of the thousand little pieces flying everywhere would be... i-irresistible.
All the energy is spent now, 'tis just a piece of crystal. As tempting as it is to toss it on the ground and hear it shatter, I shall refrain. I can resist the urge for wanton destruction... clearly.
... Oh dear. My hand slipped. Both of them. Let's continue.
No, I've grown impatient with this. Let us simply get on with it.
Well, I tried. Time to move on, shall we?
Well, that's a lot cooler... but now my legs are all sweaty...
It'll be nice to cool off a bit, even if I am feeling a tad overexposed for it...
And of course, 'tis the season for static electricity.
Fie, undignified 'til the last. Pray continue, I just need a few seconds.
Ah, and then there's this mess to contend with...
Hm, the floor is cleaner than I expected. There is a surprising lack of, well, stickiness. I'd not be surprised if this was the only spot of its kind...
I suppose I'm glad the ground here is not muddy or damp.
The small silver lining here is the sand is far more pleasant against my skin than through my socks.
I rather enjoy the feeling of grass underfoot, though present circumstances have doused my enthusiasm for it.
Splendid, now I must watch out for bird droppings...
Hard, rough, and cold. As if things weren't unpleasant enough.
At least we're at the beach where... this sort of thing... is not helping me...
Beaches are for swimwear... not undergarments...
I had hoped being in this state of undress on the beach would be as if I were in my bathing suit, but in all honesty I do not feel that way at all.
The dress code here appears to be swimwear... but even so...
Swimwear seems the same as undergarments... up until the moment you're left standing in the latter...
The other patrons here are wearing swimsuits while I am in my unmentionables. 'Tis not the same at all...
Seems there is an added level of cruelty playing strip poker in such a cold place.
Ha, listen to me rambling about fish. Mayhap I should have eaten before coming here. I could do with a bit of grilled sweetfish.
Speaking of fish, I could go for a bite to eat. Does the Inventory ever serve eel pie?
Why all this talk of fish? Mayhap I'm craving salt cod puffs. Can you blame me?
Might be good to practice swimming at any rate. I'd not like to end up like Urianger or Alphinaud.
Lyse and Alisaie were blessed by the Kojin to be able to swim underwater indefinitely. When I go swimming, I can manage maybe a minute with my head under.
I am an okay swimmer. The scion's skills range from those who are literally undrownable and those who do naught but drown. It has become a sore subject among us.

state.text: I may be blind, but harsh sunlight still harms my eyes. I still need them to see using the ambient aether, so I must needs take care of them.

case.state: In case you were wondering, these are ordinary sunglasses. They don't impede my ability to see aether, but they do protect my eyes from the sun.
My aetheric sight requires the use of my eyes still, so protecting them from sun damage is still a must.
It felt small while I was wearing it, but now that it's off it feels like quite the difference.
I suppose the value was not in how much it covered but in what that little coverage managed to hide.
The excitement was a bit much just having to wear it, but taking it off really has my heart racing...
... So, where were we?
Ahem... I'm ready to continue.
Hm, yes, pardon me. Are we prepared for the next hand?
It makes me wonder what Lady Lisette is like in the off season. Mayhap she just stockpiles heart shaped trinkets until the day finally comes back around.

Despite being of nobility, every time I've seen Lady Lisette she's dressed like a baker. A very well off baker, to be sure, but she's still so unlike any of the other ladies or lords in Ishgard. 'Tis... refreshing, I'd say.

Of course, Lady Lisette is never alone in her endeavors. She brings with her a whole host of knights and attendants to decorate and spread word of celebrations. 'Tis all very impressively coordinated.
Of course- oh, bother. My hair is all matted, isn't it? One moment.
That being said- ah, wait. I've got hat hair now, don't I? This is why I never wear them...
So essentially- hm? Is there something weird about my hair? Mayhap a hat was a poor decision...
I'm sure no one will object to me loosening this a bit? These are still men's clothes and the fit is not entirely perfect.
And this is coming down a ilm. 'Tis a bit difficult to relax with this so firmly around my neck.
I suppose one must suffer for fashion, but as mine has all but dissolved I see no issue with making this a bit less formal.
Personally, I'm not prone to bouts of loneliness. If anything, I'm around the other Scions far too often. One must needs a moment alone to enjoy a cup of tea or the tome she's set aside.
Though, I do pause to wonder how it would be if I did have somebody to spend this sort of holiday beside, or if were to confess to- ah, just wishful thinking...
For my part, I know Valentione's Day will end and the star will still remain imperiled. I'll not have any time left to spare a thought to romance for a time.
Of course, there's no reason I cannot be simultaneously brave and modest.
Somehow, without the lingerie, I feel less exposed? Surely this is not as provocative as before?
I suppose there's some small part of me that's grateful those undergarments got some use in. Gods know I'm not showing it off for anyone else.
Everyone paints Archon eggs and prays for the return of the Archons of eld to protect us. Mayhap this juxtaposition of eggs and resurrection is strange to outsiders.
We have a tradition of painting Archon eggs which some people believe the gods of eld shall be reborn from. 'Tis a prayer for resurrection, of sorts.
All across Eorzea, people are painting Archon eggs in hopes that a god will resurrect from one. All the bunnies and chickens are just for decoration.
This is the effect of a potion known as a Fantasia. One drought and the next morning a person awakens in a whole new body.
My transformation is thanks to a potion known as a Fantasia. One drink before bed and I literally woke up a new woman.
The process is actually quite simple. I drank a potion known as a Fantasia and then I woke up like this! Fun, right?
Some change for fun or for ignoble reasons, but there are some who never felt at home in their original body. It was for them the potion was created, to improve their lives.
People change for all sorts of reasons, good and bad. The original purpose, as you may have surmised, was to help those who felt uncomfortable with their appearance.
To be able to slip into the skin of one's own choosing is an luxury some take for granted. For others, 'tis a solution to a persistent discomfort.
The loss of my tail has been... a difficult adjustment. I'm looking forward to getting it back.
I underestimated how much of an adjustment losing my tail would be. Standing and walking is alright, but much more than that...
A tail is very useful for balancing and the like. It makes a miqo'te nimble and lithe; however, without my tail... less so.
Okay, okay, I'm done pining the loss of my tail... probably.
How does anyone get by without a tail? Without it I feel so... so not like myself.
I'd trade my last scrap of clothing to get my tail back. Honestly, I would.
Blah, blah, blah, pact making. Blah, blah, blah, lemures. Blah, blah, blah, martial application. 'Tis only a temporary thing, I assure you. There, now all our fears are put to bed.
This transformation is merely temporary, I promise. That being said, I'd rather forgo any lengthy explanation and waste that precious little time.
'Tis all in the name of inquiry and I'll return to normal ere long. Now that we have that settled, I'll thank you not to bore me with a thousand additional questions about it.
I'm allowed to retain a bit of modesty, right? Before you answer, just remember that this cloth is far thicker than flesh... 'tis a joke you need not look so terrified.
Sorry, not much of a seamstress. When my clothes get torn, I usually just live with it. Here, let me demonstrate...
Don't worry, I picked these clothes knowing they might be destroyed. Seems tampering with magicks not well understood by man has a good track record of leaving me nude.
There we go! Brute force is much more fun than I gave it credit for.
Ah, that's better. Now let's see if I can get the buckle on the other side to snap in half.
And there it goes! See, I'm a master of magic and muscles now. A rousing success, wouldn't you say?
I don't mean to overdo things, but I was so nervous about this experiment and now I can punch holes in concrete walls. I've just got... a lot of steam to blow off.
This is only temporary, so forgive me if I overindulge a little... or a lot. Sorry, but I've not felt this lively in a while.
I'll try and dial it back a little. I'm not used to feeling this strong, so I may have gotten carried away. Besides, I can't completely destroy my clothes. I still have to get home somehow.
Well, I didn't make my way here like this for academic purposes anyway. Just for a potential bit of fun...
Mayhap I shall learn something about myself this way. If I do not, then at least I had fun doing it.
Hm, seems like no matter how this ends I shall enjoy myself quite thoroughly...
It just would not do to wend my way through the streets of Eorzea with these on full display. I daresay industry would come to a halt.
Oh well, a problem for later. No sense in fretting over it now and spoiling the fun.
I can scarcely have these out while I make my way home. 'Tis not the kind of surprise folks are anticipating this season.
Ah well, I'll figure it out later. I promise I'll refrain from stealing anyone else's clothes to do so.
There is a veritable army of the "Saint's Little Helpers" wearing very much the same uniform running about Eorzea right now. All busy preparing presents and meals for those in need.

While I don't personally count myself among the "Saint's Little Helpers" who assist with the festivities, I've always though the uniforms were cute. Besides, I am busy defending the realm which none can say is not helpful.
Eorzea is currently full of "Saint's Little Helpers" wearing very much the same uniform as I. You'd be hard pressed to find an adventurer who was not eagerly helping set up for the festivities.

Well, perhaps he's been too busy to find something for me too. I'll just get him some donuts or some such pastries and he will give me, oh I don't know, the carcass of a scorpion he's been carrying around for weeks.
Seems like everything he wants he procures or makes himself, and those things he does not are given to him by Tataru. Doesn't leave much room for anyone else to attend to his needs.
Hm, maybe I should simply take a page out of his book. I'll just wander afar until something laying on the ground reminds me of him. Ah, he does so love the detritus of the world.
Oh, but the berries are quite poisonous. The leaves and boughs are safe for animals to eat, but unfortunately this enduring symbol is a poor source of nutrition for us.
The berries are actually quite poisonous to men and beast alike. Alas, though she encourages us to endure the harsh winter, she offers naught else but encouragement.
Holly is cultivated purely for decorative purposes as her berries are poisonous and should not be eaten. That hope she offers to last the winter is not backed up by any substance for men, I'm afraid.
Though, at the moment, I suppose I wouldn't mind getting a hairbrush.
Hm, except maybe I could use a hairbrush, but just to borrow it for a bit.
That being said, I'd be happy for a hairbrush to use for just a second.
Though, that's likely wishful thinking. 'Tis like you'd like to continue losing. Well... if it's all in the spirit of the season.
... But obviously this may not be the end of it. 'Tis not like I am opposed to sticking around... for all your sakes, of course.
Truly, my generous spirit is in full force to~background.time~.
If any of you have designs to take this because of the gemstones, you will be sorely disappointed should the glamour dispel.
No precious gems to be found here, mind you. The appearance of this necklace has been magically altered via a glamour.
I should point out this necklace is actually quite cheap. Any appearance of luxury is due to a glamour spell.
Upon my return, Tataru was kind enough to prepare these clothes for not just me, but my fellow Scions Urianger and Thancred as well.
Of course, Tataru, blessing that she is, was able to furnish me with clothing identical to those I had in the First. It made coming back just a bit easier.
I couldn't bring my clothes from the First with me, but our ever industrious receptionist Tataru was able to make replacements.
I'd very much like to see them all again. Mayhap if I can unravel some of the secrets of The Inventory's extra-dimensional properties, I could make my way back to the First.
The Source and the First are as separate as any of our respective worlds, but if The Inventory could bring us together then mayhap it could reunite me with The Night's Blessed.
I hoped I could see the Night's Blessed again, but alas The Inventory guards her secrets jealously. More research is required before I might go between worlds.
Okay, be calm, Shtola... it's not more than you'd show off at the beach... if ever you took your leisure at the beach...
I keep thinking I've worn less on the beach, but it continues to not comfort me. Can we continue so I may cease thinking about it?
I'm sure after a deep breath or ten, standing about in my undergarments won't bother me so much...
Not exactly a graceful dismount, but the boots are off regardless. Hopefully my efforts to disallow you a view under my dress will not be in vain.
There! No more boots. It wasn't graceful, but at least it was done with a modicum of decency. Now I must needs not lose again...
Perhaps one glimpse up my skirt would have been less embarrassing than jumping about like that. I will just need to avoid losing from now on.
... So, where were we?
Ahem... I'm ready to continue.
Hm, yes, pardon me. Are we prepared for the next hand?
Perhaps I should rethink my strategy here...
These losses are encroaching upon troublesome territory.
My feet and calves, for those who care for such things. If I can help it, you'll see naught else.
Aye, it's no big deal, right? Your opponents can see naught unbecoming and you haven't lost completely... yet...
Hang in there, Shtola. Lose focus here and you stand to lose more...
Deep breaths, Shtola... just take deep breaths.
Most unfortunate, ~player~. Seems like you lost your focus for a moment there. You're not getting drowsy, are you?
I saw that, ~player~. You were so busy staring at me you hardly even glanced at your cards. Perhaps now's not the time for daydreaming?
~Player~, do you need a break? You seem to be having trouble focusing on the game.
Redundancy is is the best security.
Well... the idea may not be as far-fetched as all that.
I think "confusing" is understating... whatever it is he has going on.
So, rules are for... "schmucks," was it? How is that attitude treating you?
What was the term you used? "Schmuck?" Seems your disregard for convention has landed you in hot water.
I've not given up hope entirely that mayhap I could come to understand you, Bobobo, even if just a little.
Is it too much to hope that playing this game with you, Bobobo, might help me understand you a little better?
You know, Bobobo, you've been less than candid about your own ability to travel between dimensions. 'Twould seem with your talent you could transport me to The First without much issue.
Since I have you bound to this game, Bobobo, mayhap now would be a good time to ask about your own ability to travel between worlds. Seems you could even find your way to the First if you wished to.
You were so down on following rules earlier, but now there's suddenly some set of rules that is sacrosanct to you? Care to proffer an explanation?
If I am understanding you correctly, Bobobo, you're saying that it is my own preference that keeps you from transporting me to my ultimate destination? I suppose... you're not wrong.
You are going to play by the rules, right?
I know you struggle with convention, Bobobo, but can we trust you'll abide by the rules?
This is why it pays to have a care, Bobobo.
If only you'd saved some other article you were wearing previously.
I know he's standing in nothing but his pants before us, but I have the strangest feeling that we're being taken for a ride...
I'm sure there's some scheme afoot here that the rest of us are too sane and rational to perceive...
Haven't we already done this?
Oh, look. It's the selfsame situation Bobobo found himself in the last time he lost the hand.
Bobobo, eventually you are going to run out of ways to surprise us.
So, is there going to be yet more pants?
I hope this means we can say good-bye to Don Patch.
Good-bye, Don Patch. It has been... borderline tolerable.
Oh, something in Cat Noir's aether is shifting. Mayhap we are about to meet the man behind the mask.
An unfortunate turn, Cat Noir. Now, which is coming off? The ears or the tail? Clearly neither one is part of your actual body.
More's the pity, ~target~.
It appears you've fallen short, ~target~.
~Target~, time for you to take a turn.
And with that concluded, ~target~, if you would...
I had been hoping ~target~ might suffer a loss.
Uh-oh, ~target~. Looks like it's your turn.
Alright, ~target~, what do we have coming to us?
You must needs take a harder look at the odds, ~target~.
Apologies, ~target~, but your loss is my gain.
My, each round is as exciting as it is nerve wracking.
I'll take what small relief I can.
Oh, ~target~ lost? I was sure for a moment there that it was me instead.
Oh, ~target~ this time? Well, that's a relief.
No matter which cards I hold, each victory feels like a close call.
Mayhap it is due to my predicament, but the game is quite exciting like this.
Well now, what have we here?
There is a catharsis in seeing ~target~ lose.
Just not your round, ~target~?
If it were all up to me, ~target~ would have gotten up to this loss far earlier.
Well, this is passing strange. Even on vacation the shadows follow me.
'Tis only fitting that I'd try and leave my worries in Eorzea behind for a spell only to have a lone shadow follow me.
I've never known an Ascian to indulge in recreation. I cannot begin to piece together what has inspired you to come here dress in such a manner.
I find it hard to believe something like you would dress yourself in such a manner for a leisurely day by the water. Is there some angle I'm missing here?

condition.saying: Ain't party members supposed to work together?

case.state: Don't presume to pin this on me, Bobobo. Each player's fate is ultimately in their own hands. We are not a party of adventurers cooperating to achieve one goal; we are competitors.
If that is what you desire, I do believe it can be arranged, May. I may be on vacation, but I'm willing to put in the work for your sake.
Well, aren't you eager? Does this mean I can simply take my leisure from here on out?
Oh dear. 'Twas merely a matter of time, really.
Hold on, Laevatein! 'Tis merely a game; there's no need to be hasty...
A summoning? I should have expected to encounter such magics in a place like this.
So, does this mean you will be shedding some light on this big mystery of yours?
Aimee, 'tis bad sport to take up your arms when you lose. Could you simply-
Aimee! No! Stay your weapon!
If Aimee lost, that means one thing...
Aimee, is there any chance you might listen to reason?
I'd almost prefer it if this madwoman did not lose!
Shimakaze's luck has been particularly bad, and I don't just mean her cards...
I'm guessing we should all brace for impact?
Is it cruel to let Shimakaze lose like this when it means she's going to take another hit?
My apologies, Shimakaze. I do hope this leaves you unharmed...
Shimakaze really is something else. If I exploded even once during this game, I'd never return to this place.
Oh no. Remember, Shimakaze, I can heal you if the need arises...

At first glance I thought Senko might've been a Miqo'te like me. Aside from her aether indicating she's more than a mortal being, I think it was the tail that really tipped me off that we are not quite the same.
I must confess, Fina. When I first saw you I was a bit worried you were a Garlean. 'Tis clear to me now that the mark on your forehead is not a third eye.
Pray forgive the question, but are those weapons hanging at your side? I'm not terribly well-versed in the machinist arts, but they do look like many of the firearms I've seen.
Are you some manner of machinist, Revy? I'm unfamiliar with firearms myself, but if I'm not mistaken those are what you have strapped to your sides, correct?

Apologies if this is an intrusive question, but am I to understand your race loosed itself from the bonds of its star to travel the expanse beyond? I'm quite curious to know how such a feat could be achieved.

If I may be so bold, I've got quite the number of questions for you, Meia. To travel the vast expanse beyond your own star, your people must be quite wise. I simply must know how such a feat is even possible.
Strange though it may sound, having you here is a bit of a comfort, Jura. You bear a passing resemblance to an old friend of mine from back home.
I hope it doesn't sound too strange, but your presence is somewhat comforting. You remind me of someone: a friend of mine from back home.
So, Nami, I take it you're some manner of thaumaturge by trade? Or mayhap you are an adventurer, only plying black magics as a means of defense?
You're not dressed like most of the thaumaturges I've known, Nami. Mayhap you're more of an adventurer, using black magic as a means of defending yourself.
I'm curious to see if this one will abide by the rules. By merit of what she is, 'tis easy to surmise what her ends are.
So, is this one keen to follow the rules? Even if she plays fair, by her very nature 'tis plain what her ends are.
So, Fina, you're an adventurer too? Did you get your start chasing wharf rats or were you taken on as part of a larger company?

Forgive my ignorance, Cynthia, but it has been impressed upon me that you are a champion in the world you hail from. This is a title you've acquired through some kind of contest of arms, if I'm not mistaken?
I've heard tale that you hold the title of champion in your world, Cynthia. You won your renown through victories in some martial contest. Do I have the right of it?
What even brings a thing like you to a place like this? Even knowing your intentions, it still begs the question: why here? Why this place?
Despite your origins from beyond this star, your appearance doesn't betray that. You're so unremarkable, the thought would have never once crossed my mind just by looking at you.
You're not at all what one would expect from a visitor from beyond the star, Meia. Do not take this the wrong way, but you've a shockingly average appearance considering your origins.
So, Vyse and Aika? These are friends of yours, I take it? You speak of them quite fondly, almost as if they were family.
How does one get into such a hobby? Training PokÃ©mon for the purpose of combat? Is this commonplace where you come from?
Is training PokÃ©mon a popular activity where you come from? 'Tis a bit hard for me to imagine myself...
I just want to be sure that 'twould not be in bad taste to mention the box...
Is the box a sore subject, or would it be gauche to ask about it?
Zoe is clearly some variety of voidsent, but she doesn't come off as hostile. Seems rude to be ill at ease, but...
A stroke of bad luck for you, Fina. I assume this is not usually the sort of adventurous undertaking you would engage in.
There's something... peculiar about this one. What is this power running through her? It's so... macabre.
'Tis interesting to hear of your people's colonizing of other planets, Meia. 'Tis not unlike the dragon's colonization of our own star.
Fina, I hate to presume, but I feel compelled to ask. Could these leggings possibly be your last piece of clothing?
I've naught but respect for you, Fina, but I have this nagging feeling these leggings may actually be all you have left to strip off.
Such a curious little familiar. Rather well spoken for a construct.
Can't say I've ever seen a goblin without their mask on. Is this really what they look like under there?
'Tis uncommon in Eorzea for one to depend upon a beast to assist in battle; however, there are many adventurers who have trained their Chocobos to fight at their side.
I'm quite curious to learn about the crystal you're carrying with you, Fischl. 'Tis such a dense collection of electrical power. I take it this is a source of power for you to draw upon?
Hardly. I mean no offense, but you don't particularly strike me as someone who can appreciate my collection.
I deal with gunfire on a regular basis. This sort of trial, however...

Why stop at Limsa? The streets of Ul'dah are rife with the same craven lot. As for myself, 'twould be fair to say I've grown accustomed to it, but not comfortable. One learns to walk briskly and feign ignorance.
Oh, my name is inconvenient? This is certainly the first I'm hearing about it.
Well, ~target~, don't be shy. You're in quite good company for this.
Don't fret, ~target~. We'll be in dire straits together.
You'll feel better once you've unloaded a bit of your burden.
I'd apologize, but I'm not actually feeling particularly remorseful.
Hm, I do find ~target~ rather cute. I wouldn't mind seeing a bit more of her.
Strange. What is this feeling? Disappointment I won the round? Interesting...
No need for trepidation, ~target~, even if it is the season of fear.
I can only offer my apologies.
With such long odds to win, you must have expected it could play out this way.
~Target~, now's the time for you to have your turn.
Sorry, ~target~, but clearly we all wanted to see a little more of you.
Didn't think it would turn out this way, did you?
A bit of misfortune there, ~target~?
Don't forget, ~target~, you're free to bow out if need be.
Seems you had a little trouble, ~target~.
One card in this hand or that makes quite the difference.
Apologies, ~target~, but that's how the game is played.
It may be selfish, but I'd rather ~target~ lose over myself.
Any apology I could offer you, ~target~, would likely ring hollow.
The conclusion of each round is both exciting and mortifying when I am this close to defeat.
'Tis a shame, but I'm happy it was not me. Apologies, ~target~.
'Tis worrisome that I don't feel as guilty about ~target~ losing as I should...
Glad to not lose, at the least.
Don't look at me, ~target~. This wasn't my doing.
It's not worth much, but you do have my sympathies.
I should caution you, ~target~, of the dangers of losing too may rounds.
Not much fun in losing. Right, ~target~?
By the Twelve, what are the odds of this? The hands are matched card for card!

state.text: Somehow this outcome is as surprising as it is anticlimactic.

case.state: Not that I'm ungrateful for that, but it needs be said you were the one who asked me to come here. I was contented to conduct my own research back in Eorzea.
You're nearly making a salient point, Bobobo. What's the punchline?
That sentence makes-huh? Wait! What are you...!
Layers of bravado...
Ah, yes, very funny. If only it were that easy for one to cross the barriers between worlds.
You brought this upon yourself. I've no sympathy for your plight.
'Twould seem you've fallen into a trap of your own making. You'll be down and out if you continue to play in such a manner.
It might avail you to limit yourself to just one of your remaining items this time.
Should I ever become accustomed to the sight of those nosehairs, that is when I'll know I've lost my sanity.
Considering what is at stake, this all seems to be in rather poor taste.
H-hold on! What is that?
B-Brock! Mind your weaponry!
Hey! That is not a toy! I would urge you to take more caution!
Stalling, ~target~? You look ready to forfeit from where I'm standing.
Yes, well, I did not think you would be capable of becoming more indecent than you already are.
Ha, seeing as ~target~ is already exposed I'd not expected much more than this. Oh well, what can one do?
Aye, a wise move were you not already so exposed...
Your ~clothing~? Should I take this as proof of your voyeuristic tendencies?
You forestall your ultimate defeat, ~target~. You are already exposed, why not just forfeit and relieve yourself?
Is that it? Not much of a show...
Hm... growing bored. Shame that I am out of things to break.
Is that the best you can muster? I'd ask you redouble your efforts next time.
What a waste of a turn. I'll need more excitement than that.
I find myself left wanting...
Not particularly manly...
I broke free of my shackles for this? Nay, it will not do.
One thing at a time, right ~target~?
Fend off your nudity as long as you can, ~target~. It's the only sensible strategy.
You won't hear me object to tributing the little things, so long as you don't overdo it.
That will do nicely for this round.
Seems to be a wise choice.
Aye, I can appreciate the wisdom in that move.
Just going piece by piece no matter the size, ~target~?
I've no objections to counting that as a tribute. Strikes me as an odd choice, but I'm not one to judge.
It's not much, but at least it's a step closer.
What I wouldn't give to have something like your ~clothing~ left.
I used up all my small bits like your ~clothing~ already. I wish it had not come to that.
I have no objections. I'll take my victories wherever I can find them.
I took my leisure in removing my smaller pieces too, ~target~. As you can see, it did not avail me.
Oh well, I suppose that is the way it is.
This is not making me feel good about my odds of beating ~target~...
Not much of a loss, is it?
Yes, I fully understand your reservations.
Somehow, I feel more humiliated watching that...
You continue to be as stubborn as you are peculiar. I'm still not fully unconvinced you're not some manner of fae creature.
You've the appearance and presence of a Hyur, but all the madness and guile of some fae trickster...
Of course. Mayhap all I need understand about you, Bobobo, is that at each turn you will attempt to defy understanding.
You are consistent only in that you are inconsistent.
As always, punctuating your point with antics like... whatever this is, really robs the conversation of all gravitas.
Wait, if 'twould be that easy for you, why don't you just do it?
I have the distinct feeling that somehow you're not in as much peril as you appear to be...
Knowing you, you've probably got some trick up your sleeves... or at least, up somewhere.
Of course. Not just a ruse, a completely asinine ruse.
Gods... so was this the most idiotic plan you were able to concoct?
Was this plan supposed to be impressive somehow?
You are inordinately proud of this little scheme of yours...
Okay, perhaps you will not run out of ways to surprise us...
I believe this was inevitable. How could a man who cannot keep his trousers up hope to hold onto his ~clothing~?
If it is of any consolation, your ~clothing~ did very little to distract from your manhood.
I doubt this round will stick out in anybody's mind moving forward.
Though, 'tis a bit hard to stand in judgment given my predicament.
You're an odd one for sure, ~target~, but you're right at home here, aren't you?
The eye is still drawn to the same place as before.
Perhaps I was wrong to think ~target~ could sate my appetite.
No use in complaining about it. I'll just have to wait for someone of substance to lose.
Come now, give me something I can work with, ~target~.
Let's pick the momentum back up, shall we?
Naught to do but carry on.
Nothing for it but to let you lose once again, and then maybe one more time.
'Tis not my style to threaten physical violence, but I might be inclined to scold you...
No sense in faffing about. Let the game continue.
I hardly think we need dwell on this anymore than ~target~ has.
And the world spins madly on. Come now, the game hasn't ended.
Perhaps there will be more excitement in this next round.
Mind your next move, ~target~, lest you suffer a further loss.
The excitement is palpable still.
No matter how safe you play it, your luck may turn against you.
Don't get thrown, Shtola. Focus on the game.
I see clearly now that the knife cuts both ways.
Our sensibility for stripping clearly matches, so I can only assume my playing is what's lacking.
Had you removed something more substantial, I might have had an extra second or two to brace myself for the coming round...
'Tis odd, but I do feel a bit optimistic that I could beat you again next round ~target~.
Mayhap 'tis you, ~target~, who should be preparing to lose this next round.
You haven't left me particularly inspired, if I'm being honest.
Another round for the rest of you then. As for me...
I thought your loss might afford me even a modicum of... ahem... "inspiration."
Seems like a portion of Perona's aether detached itself. What is happening?
I just saw a bit of your aether disperse from your body, Perona. Is this some sort of offensive magic?
Ah, that begs the question of who is going to bestow it upon you or rather who you'd like to do so.
Fine, fine, be whatever it is that pleases you. I'm currently more concerned with your intentions. Don't think I'll not postpone my leisure to intervene.
Ascian or no, you make no secret of your intentions. Still, given the situation I suppose I could simply let you pass in peace should your intent not be actively malicious.
That nearly sounds reasonable, but your sentiment makes it seem the decision wasn't yours alone. I don't see anything else like you around here, so it seems dubious you have an ally about.
You make it sound as though there are others like you around here; however, 'tis plain to me that you're the only one of your sort.
'Tis quite the shame you must doff those flowers. Seems like you took great pains to arrange them so.
Dressed like that, you've very nearly backed yourself into a corner, Sheena. Quite a bit more daring that I could hope to be.
And there she goes. It's a shame, but if she's not resolved to stay what can we do?
Oh, adjusting your form, I see.
Oh? A viera?
Yes... might we refrain from summoning voidsent to this place?
Miqo'te will do quite fine for me, thank you. I do believe I've heard the term "kitsune" in Othard and Kugane, far to the east of my own home. You're a sight smaller than what they described.

I'll not press the matter if the subject is sensitive. Even if you were Garlean, I'd like to think I'm mature enough to look past the circumstances of one's lineage. Forgive my wariness, but war does that to a person.
And you anticipate I'll simply stand by and let you do whatever you please?
Not much for subtlety, are we? Typical for your sort. Seems we're destined to be at odds with one another.
Oh, rescued by pirates and then taken into their employ? A story I've heard the like of many a time before. Though, your story does lack a subsequent attack by the Sahagin, fish men.
Pithy, but it hardly answers the question. Something drew you here. If the where of the matter is not so important, there must be some what or who that has enticed you.
Fine, so this place itself is inconsequential to you, but the fact remains you're still here. Your sort isn't the type to drift about aimlessly, so 'tis plain something or someone has willed this.
You make it sound like it was an accident of fate, but that seems... unlikely. Something drew you to this place, or perhaps even someone...
So this weather manipulation is via magitek rather than spellcraft? I do find it a bit hard to picture you commanding the sort of fearsome war machina that could utilize such a terrifying power.
Looks like the aether gathered in your staff has dissipated. Likely needs repairs from so much use.
Oh dear, it would appear your staff is broken. Its aetheric properties are all but dissipated.
Shimakaze? Y-You're on fire! Are you alright?
First a sudden fire, and now your boots are crumbling? Is there some cause for this?
Oh! It's her head this time!
This seems like an awful lot of fuss for your bow. Is something amiss, Blake?
Oh, some manner of glamour? I've seen such performances at the aetheryte plaza in Limsa Lominsa.
I'm quite glad we can count on Akko to keep these proceedings lively!
Well, clearly you are more concerned with losing than with being nude. Am I wrong?
So nudity is fine but losing the game is unacceptable to you? Is that the meaning I am to take from this?
Who would even think to object considering what you've given us thus far?
Clearly we have different sensibilities when it comes to playing this game...
I suppose I can at least understand your desire not to lose completely, if you even have that desire...
Your ~clothing~? That move seems... backwards?
Oh? So you had planned on taking ~clothing.ifPlural(those|that)~ off all along?
Well, fair is fair. Not terribly exciting though.
I could tolerate a bit more fanfare than that from you, ~target~.
What? Is that it? I was certainly hoping for more.
It will do, if you insist upon it. Leaves hunger gnawing at me though...
An understated move, ~target~. I suppose I should not scold your pragmatism.
Yes... well... it lacks excitement. Leaves one hungry...
Oh? Will that be all? I understand, but I am slightly disappointed.
Your ~clothing~ will serve nicely. Go right ahead.
Taking it slow, ~target~? I can sympathize with that.
Don't worry overmuch that it isn't significant. It will be plenty for our purposes.
You'll hear no objections from me, ~target~. There is nothing in the letter of the rule against it.
Aye, not hard to see the wisdom in that choice.
Ha! I see you're not to be revealing anything properly risque this turn.
You seem like a woman with a plan, ~target~. Do you think it will be enough?
A small part of me hoped for some sort of distraction away from me.
Mayhap it's a small blow, but I intend to land more.
I have my work cut out for me...
Favor tips back to me, even if it is ever so slight.
Oh yes, I had several rounds like the one you're having ~target~. It has left me as you see now, lest you forgot.
Aye, taking you down is a daunting task.
A wise move if you're not keen to end up in my shoes.
No matter how wisely you strip, it will ultimately fail you if you play poorly.
Your defenses bend ~target~, but only so far.
A wise move, but fruitless if you can't turn your luck around.
With your enthusiasm, May, I don't see how it wouldn't be.

state.text: Oh my! Feeling quite brazen this night, aren't we, May?

case.state: Well, you scoff at threats just like an Ascian. Mayhap I should look on the bright side. Chances are seeing you lose this game could be cathartic.
Are you sure you're not an Ascian? You've got that same misplaced confidence they have. Fine, 'tis possible seeing you lose this game could be a bit of fun.
If you need any assistance with putting those back on, I'd be more than obliged to assist, Laevatein.
'Tis difficult to speak loudly enough to be heard over your ego...
